Text

Expedition to [the Mount of Thought]1-the mount of thought ( the third saga ) Being a free translation of the full text of D. O.lFagunwa ’s Yoruba novel [IRINKERINDONINU IGBO ELEGBEJE By Dapo AdeniyI]71-irinkerindoninu igbo elegbeje by dapo adeniyi ,

First published 1994 © Dapo Adeniyi 1994 All rights reserved . No part of this publication may be reproduced or transmitted , in any form or by any means , without prior permission of Obafemi Awolowo University Press Limited . Printed in [Nigeria]2-nigeria by : Johnmof Printers Orisunmibare Avenue , [Old Ife Road]3-old ife road Agodi P.O. Box 36012 . [Ibadan]4-ibadan . Published by [Obafemi Awolowo University Press Ltd.]5-obafemi awolowo university press ltd. , [Ile - Ife]6-ile - ife , [Nigeria]2-nigeria . Cover design , F27 /All illustrations by [Kayode Tejumola]72-kayode tejumola by [Kayode OlanipekunISBN]72-kayode tejumola 978 - 136 - 102 - 4

Triple - foolishness ascends to the throne , small - pox snatches Double - foolishness away ............................. 72 Melancholy and Pride with Precious Tongue , [[his]244-his wife]245-his wife ... 81 Inherited Lunacy of [the household of United Fools]246-the household of united fools .... 105 [Irinkerindo]73-elegbeje weds [the niece of [the Lord of Seas]248-the lord of seas]247-the niece of the lord of seas . . . . . 114 [The town of Falsehood]249-the town of falsehood ...................................... .149 The war of [the outskirt of [the forest of Elegbeje]251-the forest of elegbeje]250-the outskirt of the forest of elegbeje . . . . . 161

ACKNOWLEDGEMENT [One of [the first people to hear of this project]253-the first people to hear of this project , who received it with great enthusiasm at its earliest attempt]252-one of the first people to hear of this project , who received it with great enthusiasm at its earliest attempt , was no less [a person than [[my]0-i predecessor [himself]255-my predecessor himself]255-my predecessor himself]254-a person than my predecessor himself . [Professor Wole Soyinka]74-soyinka . One of the marks of which was [his]255-my predecessor himself acceptance to look through and offer suggestions on the first chapter that [I]0-i had completed then . [His]255-my predecessor himself encouragement and interest , coupled at times with provision of stationaries for the work lasted all the years spent on it . [I]0-i have also to acknowledge [Professor Akin Isola]75-professor akin isola , whose prompting and especially [his]75-professor akin isola recommendations to institutions and [individuals]256-individuals have largely urged the spcedy conclusion of the work , particularly at moments when 1 might have despaired . Much is owed [Drs . Biodun Jeyifo]76-drs . biodun jeyifo , [Femi Fatoba]77-femi fatoba , [Niyi Osundare]78-niyi osundare , [S.O. Babayemi]79-s.o. babayemi ( Now [Kabiyesi the Oba of Gbongan]80-kabiyesi ) , [Akin Oyetade]81-akin oyetade , [Oladipupo Fagunwa]82-fagunwa and [French translator]257-french translator , [Etienne Galle]83-etienne galle . There also are [Mrs. Folabo Ajayi]84-mrs. folabo ajayi , [Professors Bolanle Awe]85-professors bolanle awe , [Femi Osofisan]86-femi osofisan , [Jurgen Martini]87-jurgen martini and [James Gibbs]88-james gibbs . [These friends]258-these friends in [Osogbo]8-osogbo , [Ibadan]4-ibadan and [Ife]259-ife also helped to question some of [my]0-i complacencies : [Bayo^Adeleke]89-bayo^adeleke , [Gochua Okejoto]90-gochua okejoto , [Bose Agboola]91-bose agboola , [Dave]92-dave and [Silvia Olomu]93-silvia olomu , [Akin Oluyide]94-akin oluyide , [Yinka Adegboye]95-yinka adegboye ( [Bob Tay]96-bob tay ) , [Ranti Qsunfowora]97-ranti qsunfowora , [Kunle Ajibade]98-kunle ajibade , [Sesan Ajayi]99-sesan ajayi and [Dele Momodu]100-dele momodu . [I]0-i acknowledge the patience of [my]0-i typist [Mr Simeon A. Adegoke]101-mr simeon a. adegoke and IFE HUMANITIES SOCIETY which flattered the effort by including it in [Fagunwa]82-fagunwa ’s official biography . V

TVanslator ’s Forenote The very first version of this translation was begun over ten years ago , and it was preceded , partly spurred also , by [my]0-i encounter and subsequent obsession with a copy of [Soyinka]74-soyinka ’s translation of the first in the series of [Fagunwa]82-fagunwa ’s classical novels - OGBOJU ODE [NINU IGBO IRUNMALE]102-ninu igbo irunmale - of which this is the third . In the months that followed , a colleague at [the [Osogbo]8-osogbo branch of [the Oyo State Arts Council]10-the oyo state arts council]9-the osogbo branch of the oyo state arts council where [1 worked]260-1 worked then brought a weather - beaten copy of some Yoruba novel to work and abandoned it on the desks to gather dust . This , without [my]0-i suspecting it , was [IRINKERINDO NINU IGBO ELEGBEJE]73-elegbeje , stripped bare of its cover pages leaving out the actual passages of prose , from the first page . And since this particular day happened to be an idle day for [me]0-i , [I]0-i occupied [myself]0-i with savouring the text whose opening paragraph [I]0-i had translated , mostly in [my]0-i head , before [I]0-i even knew who [its author]261-its author was ! This history is essential to [the reader]262-the reader ’s understanding and perhaps sympathy with many of the choices [I]0-i have made . Moreso with specific moments in the body of the work where there are occurrences of linguistic types reminiscent of what appears in the preceding translatory work . Two reasons , [I]0-i will confess , are responsible . One is the earlier obsession with the translation [I]0-i spoke of , at a far more impressionable age . During the intervening years when [I]0-i went through revisions of [my]0-i whimsical drafts , [I]0-i discovered that what [I]0-i might be inclined to consider as childhood errors were indeed having [their]263-their own unobvious advantage , very significant to [D.O. Fagunwa]103-fagunwa ’s peculiar universe recaptured in this book and [we]264-we will also notice , in all of [his]103-fagunwa prose works . [I]0-i reminded [myself]0-i that [the same hand afterall]104-the same hand afterall composed the trilogy and two novels . So , the influence from which [I]0-i might have extricated [myself]0-i would serve to reinforce [their]265-their cosmological ties and peculiarity of style . This is why [I]0-i have retained phrases like ‘ dog - cared ” , “ pressed [my]266-my predecessor feet on [the road]3702-the road ” and “ laid [his]103-fagunwa tongue to that are vii[266-my predecessor]

in actual fact [[my]0-i predecessor]266-my predecessor ’s transliterated equivalents of precise Yoruba tonal and semantic constructions . There again arose the problem of strangeness posed by [the author]267-the author s constantly re - surfacing non - human yet near - human figures which though are [natural inhabitants of [[their]268-natural inhabitants of their yoruba environment Yoruba environment]269-their yoruba environment]268-natural inhabitants of their yoruba environment are completely unfamiliar to a new linguistic surrounding ; personae such as [iwin]270-iwin , [anjonnu , ebora]271-anjonnu , ebora , emi etc . for which [Soyinka]74-soyinka [himself]74-soyinka could conceive no other avenue for escape than to resort to “ inventive naming ceremonies ” . [I]0-i simply appropriated those inventions - ghommid , elf , spirit , daemon - to augment [my]0-i sparse additions of sprite , deities and gnome ; a more convenient alternative to delving into fresh naming ceremonies of [my]0-i own that are likely to render them even more obscure , particularly to [readers who have been familiar with the earlier effort]272-readers who have been familiar with the earlier effort . In [my]0-i prefactory note to the excerpt printed by the journal [MATATU]11-matatu , [I]0-i made elaborate comments on the web of threads , beyond just language now , that spreads dowii the length of [Fagunwa]103-fagunwa ’s major works , particularly the trilogy . There [I]0-i tried to draw an accurate map of [[Fagunwa]103-fagunwa ’s fictive world where the actions in all [his]103-fagunwa sagas]273-fagunwa ’s fictive world where the actions in all his sagas occur — a [human world]274-human world on one side and [an imaginary heaven]275-an imaginary heaven on the other whilst [the lofty fantastic forests]276-the lofty fantastic forests are placed squarely in - between . Many times [a character]277-a character in one narration is either to be re - encountered in a future narration or simply be [a paternal relation of [others there]279-others there]278-a paternal relation of others there . Likewise [a Fagunwa forest]280-a fagunwa forest in one story will likely be [a geographical neighbour]281-a geographical neighbour to [other forests in another]282-other forests in another , not to even mention events . So [a translator]283-a translator strives to keep faith not with the one immediate work alone but with unity of space , time and events enclosed in a collective world of five novels . Therefore , it serves the purposes of both convenience and propriety to keep the English alternatives of names of [people]284-people and places as they occur in [Soyinka]74-soyinka ’s work in order to affirm these inter - locked consanguinities . Very many obstacles to translation emerge which can not all be mentioned , without [my]0-i having to write a separate book . One viii

is in the mere fact that [Fagunwa]103-fagunwa here insists on a more farcical edge that enables [him]103-fagunwa to drum more with words than in any of the previous works . Thus [he]103-fagunwa enforces on [me]0-i the responsibility of not merely translating meaning but also of translating tones . There was another problem with the word [Elegbeje]73-elegbeje . Translation at once exposes the morphological constituents of this word which is otherwise secure in its Yoruba original . Elegbeje has two components : the prefix El , and egbeje , a numerical figure . Precisely one thousand and four hundred . So , put together it becomes : of or that of , a thousand and four hundred . Well , four hundred v / hat ? egbeje kini ? Is it egbeje iwin , egbeje eranko , egbeje anjonnu or what ? Hence [my]0-i introduction of the supplement , imale , [deities]285-deities ; igbo elegbeje thus reading in English : [Forest of a Thousand]286-forest of a thousand and Four Hundred Deities = igbo elegbeje imale , a subtle hint at its relationship with [Igbo Irunmale]12-igbo irunmale . [I]0-i am protected by the fact that [the story - teller]287-the story - teller [himself]287-the story - teller tells [us]288-us that , the same path leads up to both [the forests of [Irunmale]13-irunmale and [Elegbeje]73-elegbeje]289-the forests of irunmale and elegbeje . [Soyinka]74-soyinka ’s complaint about the undulating tempo of narration becomes even more evident . But it has not been in vain : every translation , especially from a tonally stressed background , loses something . But it gains too in other ways . For [a translator]283-a translator however , the motivating word is - resolution . [Readers]291-readers also will need no less be resolute in order to penetrate the walls of [a narrator so exquisite and distinct]292-a narrator so exquisite and distinct : Dapo Adcniyi Lagos , 1992

; [IRINKERINDO COMES IN(Marvels]105-irinkerindo fill [the world]293-the world over , there is [no king]294-no king as [God]106-god . [He]106-god has in [his]106-god charge all things on [Earth]15-earth and [the Heavens]16-the heavens ; [the universe]295-the universe itself is cause for wonderment . [The earth]296-the earth is filled with [men]297-men with two limbs and four - footed animals , snakes which tread on [their]297-men breasts and fishes of [the rivers]298-the rivers , birds that chirp as flutes including also [the chameleon whom [God]106-god clothes in the I colourful tweed]299-the chameleon whom god clothes in the i colourful tweed . [Highlands and lowlands]300-highlands and lowlands , the sun and the i moon , the clouds of the sky and [earth ’s soil]301-earth ’s soil , these all remain , 4 wonders . So also is the art of speech the source of separate puzzles ; those things which 1 heard sometunes past are the same words 1 have resolved to relay this day unto [[you]302-you sons of [men]297-men]303-you sons of men . And 1 exhort [you]302-you , as 1 am about to tell [them]305-their all to [you]302-you , to let them course round the corners of [your]302-you skulls , to an extent that all of [you]302-you hearing the words will let [them]305-their serve as a meal , especially [[you]302-you who are [school children]307-school children]306-you who are school children , enjoy them therefore as a distinctive chickcn - stcw that [a lovely lady]308-a lovely lady prepares , which [she]308-a lovely lady has seasoned well . It all began in the midnight one memorable day . [I]0-i heard the sudden growl of thunder , which warned about the coming of rain . [I]0-i rose from [my]0-i bed and peered outside , all about was impenetrably dark despite the fact that it was the season of moonlight . It appeared as though the skies had resolved in [their]309-their own hearts to desist from shedding light on [mankind]310-mankind . The fowl had fallen into a deep sleep , cold breeze blew softly and rodents were feasting on food - wastes in [the backyard]311-the backyard , had [a man]312-a man not tuned [his]312-a man ears to listen attentively , [he]312-a man would scarcely have heard [their]305-their mouth - movements . The owl wailed at intervals and 1 also discerned the voice of the brown bird . Behold , the bats fanned [my]0-i head with [their]305-their wings , this was because [they]305-their expressed [their]305-their own pleasures in the midnight . Even as 1 kept watch , lightning flashed sometimes and places which [I]0-i failed to see previously came clearly to [my]0-i sight . And soon 1 fell to thinking , turning myriad thoughts over in [my]0-i mind , [1]313-1 did not really know the moment when words began to 1

burst forth out of [my]0-i lips and [I]0-i began to speak out aloud thus : ‘ Benefits on [this earth]3703-this earth are unevenly distributed : [the farmer]3704-the farmer eats all [he]3704-the farmer desires in [[his]3704-the farmer own farm - hut]3705-his own farm - hut while [the labourer]3706-the labourer seeks gari about [the roadsides]3707-the roadsides ; [the king]3708-the king luxuriates in [his]3708-the king throne while [the poor]3709-the poor can not purchase a chair ; [a man with a hundred bags of money]3710-a man with a hundred bags of money struts over the face of [the earth]296-the earth while [he]3710-a man with a hundred bags of money [who can not call a penny]3712-who can not call a penny the fruit of [[his]3710-a man with a hundred bags of money beggary]3713-his beggary also takes [himself]3710-a man with a hundred bags of money about . In the very hour which [some people]3714-some people have set aside for dancing and big rejoicing , [other people]3715-other people will be plagued with wailing and will be brimming with sorrows . Ah , [God]106-god ’s wisdoms transcend the understanding of [men]297-men ’[0-i] . [I]0-i was hardly done with speaking when [somebody]314-somebody began to reply [me]0-i below the window in the following manner . ‘ It is the truth which [you]0-i speak and these really should not present much surprise to [you]0-i . [Worthy friend of the window]3717-worthy friend of the window , if matters had stood differently , [all living creatures]3718-all living creatures would have resigned into self - contentment and the progress of [mankind]310-mankind would have been still as a pond . The very day [a man]312-a man addresses [himself]312-a man saying that [his]312-a man achievements in [the world]293-the world are enough , [his]312-a man well - being is on end . [He]312-a man who resides on [ihLs earth]3722-ihls earth and fails to prepare [himself]312-a man for progress is like [a dead man amongst [the living]3724-the living]3723-a dead man amongst the living . If [the world]293-the world was flooded with excitement , [men]297-men would not have learnt to commit sorrow to writing ; if [the world]293-the world was full of money - bags , [men]297-men would hardly have understood the place of poverty ; if [the world]293-the world were all victory , scarcely would [men]297-men master the art of adapting [oneself]297-men to moderate rejoicing at the event of overcoming difficulties . Therefore , [[my]314-somebody good companion of the window]3731-my good companion of the window , [the creator]3732-the creator ’s thinking was well measured before [he]3732-the creator set about creating [man]3733-man as [he]3732-the creator has done ’[314-somebody] . [I]0-i was gripped by fright when [I]0-i heard these words . [I]0-i pray [God]106-god protect [us]315-us from the hands of [that unexpected stranger who replies [a man in the middle of the night]317-a man in the middle of the night]316-that unexpected stranger who replies a man in the middle of the night . Even as [the man]318-the man approached the close of [his]318-the man discourse , there came a bright spark of lightning and looking in the direction of the sounds , [I]0-i caught a glimpse of [him]318-the man . [He]318-the man stooped by the wall of [the house]319-the house , clad in [hunter]320-hunter ’s shorts and vest , and rested [his]318-the man gun to the wall . 2

Even as [the man]318-the man approached the close of [his]318-the man discourse , there came a bright spark of lightning . 3

This [I]0-i failed to comprehend . Even as [I]0-i began to consider demanding what [he]318-the man was all about , a heavy rainfall began and [the man]318-the man rapped on [my]0-i door calling , ‘ [friend]3734-friend , open this door to [me]318-the man ’[318-the man] , whereupon [I]0-i went to ease the bolts of the door to admit [him]318-the man in . [He]318-the man had stepped fully inside before [I]0-i began to realise what eminent personality it was . This is because the face of [a thief]323-a thief differs from the face of [the well - disposed]324-the well - disposed and the words of the lips of [a bandit]325-a bandit from the words of [a hunter]326-a hunter , [slaughterer of elephants]327-slaughterer of elephants . [I]0-i greeted [him]318-the man and [he]318-the man [himself]318-the man responded warmly with salutations . [I]0-i offered [him]318-the man a chair and [he]318-the man took [his]318-the man seat . [I]0-i also chose one for [myself]0-i and proceeded to place [my]0-i buttocks on it when [he]318-the man begged the favour of a drink . So [I]0-i rose and fetched [him]318-the man a cup of water . After [he]318-the man had drained it to satisfaction , [I]0-i lowered into [my]0-i own chair and turned to face [him]318-the man . And as [I]0-i began to consider asking how it came to be that [he]318-the man emerged thus out of the night , [he]318-the man [himself]318-the man began to speak the words that follow : ‘ All things over [the earth]296-the earth have their reasons for coming into being : as trees have their roots , so do rivers their sources , the cockerel traces its origin to the egg — [your]3736-you seeing [me]318-the man in this particular hour of the night is not without its own cause . [I]318-the man am [the man who answers to the name [Irinkerindo]105-irinkerindo]3737-the man who answers to the name irinkerindo , [the one who wander.s north and south , whose abode is in [the House of Wandering]3739-the house of wandering]3738-the one who wander.s north and south , whose abode is in the house of wandering . It is some time now since [I]318-the man began [my]318-the man search for [you]3736-you and hardly is there [any single place on [this earth]3703-this earth which [I]318-the man have not yet explored during the course of [my]318-the man searching]3740-any single place on this earth which i have not yet explored during the course of my searching . end is in the pit . The end of a double hundred rainfall is a double hundred dryness , [the river]341-the river seeks [its]341-the river own end to [sea]342-sea . found [their]412-my path into [[my]0-i mother]3767-my mother ’s heart and [[our]414-our house]3750-our house assumed the quietude of night . ‘ It was [you]3814-you , [[my]412-my father]3742-my father , who started researches into this matter . It will surely amaze [you]429-you to hear that before [my]0-i arrival in [the country]430-the country , [the one whom [I]0-i sought]431-the one whom i sought had already conversed with [his]431-the one whom i sought heels and sped away . [He]431-the one whom i sought had learned of [my]0-i mission somehow and had gone under the wraps in [a farm]432-a farm . All [my]0-i efforts to detect [his]431-the one whom i sought hiding - place proved to be abortive . It took a while before [his]431-the one whom i sought presence on [the farm]433-the farm came to [my]0-i knowledge , so [I]0-i deployed [guides who took [me]0-i to [the place]435-the place]434-guides who took me to the place . [God]106-god extended [His]106-god infinite mercies unto [me]0-i on this day so much that , before [he]431-the one whom i sought became aware of it , [I]0-i had [him]431-the one whom i sought in [my]0-i grip . And when [he]431-the one whom i sought turned and looked into [my]0-i face [he]431-the one whom i sought began to tremble from head to feet , it was [his]431-the one whom i sought love which [he]431-the one whom i sought had for [me]0-i that cowed [him]431-the one whom i sought thus and [he]431-the one whom i sought prostrated [himself]431-the one whom i sought before [me]0-i in total penitence . [We]436-we exchanged greetings and [I]0-i chanted [his]431-the one whom i sought orik ; . Thereupon [he]431-the one whom i sought took [me]0-i to [[his]431-the one whom i sought > residence in [the town]438-the town]437-his > residence in the town and treated [me]0-i to various delicacies . It was night - time before [I]0-i could broach the subject of [my]0-i mission and [I]0-i reproached [him]431-the one whom i sought a lot over [his]431-the one whom i sought past misconducts . [I]0-i will not give in to needless details , [we]436-we proceeded [home]387-home after [I]0-i had dwelled in [the country]430-the country [myself]0-i for a full month . [I]0-i arrived back [home]387-home on the seventh year of [my]0-i departure . It was the third day after [[my]0-i father]3742-my father ’s death and [they]443-they had just laid [him]431-the one whom i sought to rest . [[My]0-i dear friend]444-my dear friend , it lacked only a little for [[my]0-i father]3742-my father ’s death to drive [me]0-i into madness . For the first three weeks after [I]0-i had grasped the fact , [I]0-i could not tell whether [I]0-i was still on [this earth]3703-this earth or [heaven]447-heaven ; [I]0-i was practically dead to [the world]293-the world . In the dawn of a certain day , [I]0-i woke up early and headed to [[[my]0-i father]3742-my father ’s graveside]450-my father ’s graveside and there wept bitterly . [I]0-i began to compose an appropriate dirge which [I]0-i rendered at the top of [my]0-i voice thus : ‘ This is what remains of [my]0-i life ! [Father]113-father , [I]0-i left [you]113-father in the state of the living and returned to find [you]113-father in the midst of the dead ! [[My]0-i father whom [I]0-i left behind]3828-my father whom i left behind has taken residence in [the grave]3829-the grave ! [Death]114-death has snatched [the strong man]3830-the strong man and taken [him]3830-the strong man [home]387-home . [Death]114-death has smitten [a man of importance]3832-a man of importance ! [[My]0-i sympathizer]3833-my sympathizer is no more ! In whom did [I]0-i repose faith besides [you]113-father [[my]0-i father]3742-my father ! Who will provide [my]0-i meals from hence ! To whom shall [I]0-i report [my]0-i troubles ! With 12[0-i]

whom shall [I]0-i hold mid - night converses ! Ah , [Death]114-death , [you]114-death oppres ­ sor of [the human- kind]451-the human- kind , what wrong have 1 committed to deserve this ? Depart , [Death]114-death , and hence be detached from [me]0-i ! [[You]114-death lone enemy of [the thousands of creatures whom [God]106-god sent into [the world]293-the world]453-the thousands of creatures whom god sent into the world]452-you lone enemy of the thousands of creatures whom god sent into the world . [Death]114-death , [you]114-death bring end to [them]455-them all , the plants of [the forest]456-the forest ; [you]114-death announce end to the snakes , the birds of the sky receive [their]457-their own ends from [your]114-death hands , even so do [you]114-death affect the animals which walk on all fours . What creature of a hardened nature are [you]114-death ! [You]114-death have no pity for [men]297-men , [you]114-death never blink or experience the smallest remorse when [you]114-death decide [our]459-our fate . Let [the man]318-the man weep till [he]318-the man bursts [his]318-the man eyeballs , [you]114-death have no concern for that at all . [Our]459-our sleeping in ashes for long periods is not sufficient to make [you]114-death repent . [Our]459-our writhling in ashes for endless seasons will not win [your]114-death sympathy . [You]114-death have no taste for sacrifice and give no regard to [sigidi]461-sigidi , neither do [you]114-death accord the magical charmbelt the smal ­ lest respect . Ah ! Do [you]114-death never pause once to consider the nature of [your]114-death own end also ? Or have [you]114-death really forgotten that end lies in wait for [you]114-death too ! [You]114-death must get ready and prepare [yourself]114-death for judgement when life comes to a close . For all creatures of [the earth]296-the earth will join hands to deliver [you]114-death to judgement . The flies even must give evidence against [you]114-death , not leaving out the ants — [they]463-they will all contribute some spite to [your]114-death damnation . The handiwork of [God]106-god all are being ruined by [you]114-death . [You]114-death have shortened the lives of the fishes , earthworms , insects , toads , snails , tortoises and the grass - cutter . The bats and the owls , the rats and boas , not leaving out the elephants , all of these have known some pain through [your]114-death whip . [They]463-they must all bear testimonies against [you]114-death . [Death]114-death , [you]114-death cruel creature , [I]0-i render [you]114-death to the judgement of [God]106-god ’ . So saying , [I]0-i left [[my]0-i father]3742-my father ’s grave and found [my]0-i way liome . The funeral was well performed and quite elaborate as well . [I]0-i did not get to see [[my]0-i father]3742-my father ’s body before [he]3742-my father was laid to rest but [[my]0-i younger]3837-my younger ones who witnessed it all recounted to [me]0-i how [relatives from far and near]3838-relatives from far and near had brought clothes , shrouds and coffin that accompanied [him]3742-my father to [[his]3742-my father grave]3839-his grave . [They]3838-relatives from far and near also slew a lot of rams . [I]0-i [myself]0-i was witness to several baskets of eko on [my]0-i 13[0-i]

return and how [drummers]464-drummers entertained [the inmates of [[our]466-our house]3750-our house]465-the inmates of our house . [I]0-i spent a lot of money during the ceremonies but even these spendings hardly sufficed to erase thoughts of [[my]0-i father]3742-my father from [my]0-i mind . When [1]0-i smiled , it was scarcely a genuine one for sorrow filled the depths of [my]0-i heart . [Iron]115-iron proves to be of a little weight compared with the nature of burden [the eldest son]477-the eldest son bears . What became a source of wonder to [me]0-i W95 that whenever [I]0-i met [him]3742-my father in the dream , [I]0-i never thought of [him]3742-my father anymore as [a dead person]481-a dead person . Usually after dreaming of [him]3742-my father like this , [I]0-i would wake up in the middle of the night and weep bitterly . After [I]0-i had feasted on the contents of the 14

mirror to [my]0-i satisfaction , [[my]0-i father]3742-my father asked [me]0-i to relate to [him]3742-my father the things that [I]0-i had seen and [I]0-i told them all to [him]3742-my father . [A manr of strength]3841-a manr of strength indeed was [he]3841-a manr of strength who answered to the name [Oyindayepo]107-oyindayepo . which [I]0-i had brought with [me]0-i from [the distant country]493-the distant country . 1 deployed [a youth]494-a youth to keep [me]0-i company and then began to conduct [myself]0-i along the route leading to [[the king]3708-the king ’s palace]496-the king ’s palace . diverse subjects . It was only five days after this when news reached [me]0-i that [he]514-he had passed on the ghost ; [I]0-i suffered a great deal of pain from the news . And the nature of [Oyindayepo]107-oyindayepo is such that [his]107-oyindayepo passing away can not but arouse grief in [one]359-one ’s heart . [I]0-i gathered also on that occasion how [you]517-you had been unhappy about [your]517-you inability to join up with [Akara - Ogun]109-akara - ogun and the others whom [we]520-we despatched recently to [Mount Langbodo]19-mount langbodo because of the errand which [he]107-oyindayepo insisted [you]517-you should run for [him]107-oyindayepo . [Your]517-you voyage to [the distant land]521-the distant land , [he]107-oyindayepo confided to [me]0-i , would make [you]517-you [a man of greater experiences and discerning]522-a man of greater experiences and discerning , qualities which would make [you]517-you to perform in the future as [[your]517-you other comrades]523-your other comrades . [Oyindayepo]107-oyindayepo , it is obvious [taall]116-taall , was [a man of solid courage]525-a man of solid courage . And since [you]517-you are stepping into [his]107-oyindayepo shoes , [I]0-i am very curious to see how [you]517-you will fit out in those shoes . ‘ The errand is this : [I]517-you have this desire to assign [you]517-you to lead a special delegation of [hunters]3867-hunters on a voyage to a certain place named [the Mount of Ironu]3868-the mount of ironu , which has [its]3868-the mount of ironu location in [the Forest of [a Thousand and Four Hundred Deities]3870-a thousand and four hundred deities]241-the forest of a thousand and four hundred deities . There is a certain tree in [that country]3871-that country whose name is Thought , [Ironu]117-ironu . It is the fruit of this same tree of thought which interests [me]517-you and which [I]517-you desire [you]517-you to pluck for [me]517-you . This tree of thought is it that gives [the country]430-the country its fame , for a mysterious tree indeed is the tree of [Ironu]117-ironu . 17[517-you]

[[My]0-i father]3742-my father has told [me]0-i a lot about this tree in [his]3742-my father time , that if this tree is planted close to the source of [[any town]527-any town ’s river]528-any town ’s river , whoever it is that drinks of it would be instantly transformed to [a wise man]529-a wise man . And yet what is it that forms the root of [the universe]295-the universe in the absence of this Ironu of which [we]531-we speak ? It is the lack of thought which leads [a man]312-a man into stealing and lures [him]312-a man to speak vile of [[his]312-a man neighbour]345-his neighbour . This same lacking in sufficient thought misleads [men]297-men into cheating [[their]297-men neighbours]535-their neighbours ; it is the thought which ignites [a motor - car]536-a motor - car ’s engine , forms the base of [the railways]537-the railways and provides the wings by which [men]297-men frolick about in the skies . [Ironu]117-ironu it is that makes victor of [a warrior]539-a warrior and forms the foundation of healing . To crown it all , if [you]540-you catch [a man]312-a man in the process of saying that [God]106-god is of a little potency , [such a man]542-such a man is clearly suffering from the lack of thought . Myriad powers give company to [Ironu]117-ironu and it marks the difference between [men]297-men and beasts . Therefore , [Irinkerindo]105-irinkerindo , [son of Oyindayepo]544-son of oyindayepo , go now and fetch [me]0-i this fruit which carries the name of Thought . Those were the words of [the king]3708-the king and when [I]0-i perceived that [he]3708-the king had finished , [I]0-i rose from [my]0-i seat and [I]0-i began to reply [him]3708-the king in the following manner : ‘ [Kabiyesi]80-kabiyesi , live long , be aged in honour . [Kabiyesi]80-kabiyesi , [I]0-i wish you.to understand it today that it is not only [he]3708-the king who takes [[one]359-one ’s mother]3877-one ’s mother to wedding alone that stands as [one ’s father]3878-one ’s father . [A man]312-a man may possess [a single father]3880-a single father and [one mother]3881-one mother , [a man]312-a man may equally be endowed with [two mothers]3883-two mothers and [two fathers]3884-two fathers , [he]312-a man can even have more than twos in [his]312-a man keeping — have n’t [we]3875-our beheld [some men]3885-some men with [[their]3885-some men fathers]3886-their fathers and [mothers]3887-mothers alive and yet [they]3885-some men pass for [fatherless children]3888-fatherless children ? Let [him]312-a man come from East or West , whoever it is that extends a hand of liking to [a man]312-a man is [[his]312-a man father]419-his father . [Kabiyesi]80-kabiyesi , while [I]0-i understand the fact that [[my]0-i father]3742-my father is no longer on the surface of [the earth]296-the earth this day , 18[0-i]

may [the king]3708-the king live long , [I]0-i know perfectly well that [you]547-you are worth [a father]548-a father to [me]0-i , ' And now with regard to this errand — [I]0-i must go . For who am [I]0-i to say no to such request ? A twig clearly will not strain its neck in the presence of the wind . [I]0-i wish [all the citizens of [this town]3894-this town]3893-all the citizens of this town Io understand it from this hour that [Oyindayepo]107-oyindayepo ’s death will not mean the end of feat ’s from [[his]107-oyindayepo household]3895-his household ; [his]107-oyindayepo departure will not brit^g the glowing moonlight of [[his]107-oyindayepo house]3896-his house into darkness . Even if it is the truth that [Oyindayepo]107-oyindayepo has shifted seat , [he]107-oyindayepo has implanted a new stalk in [his]107-oyindayepo old shoes who must take [his]107-oyindayepo place , the sandals which [[my]0-i father]3742-my father left behind [I]0-i have strapped to [my]0-i feet , [the road on which [he]107-oyindayepo trod [I]0-i am fully primed to tread]3898-the road on which he trod i am fully primed to tread , [I]0-i have woven a thick pad with which to support [his]107-oyindayepo weighty responsibilities on [my]0-i head . Ah ! How pitiful it is that the bird has flown ! [Oyindayepo]107-oyindayepo who performed marvels for [me]0-i is no more ! [He]107-oyindayepo strained [himself]107-oyindayepo for [me]0-i , ah , how [he]107-oyindayepo strained for [me]0-i ! ‘[0-i] Even so [Kabiyesi]80-kabiyesi [I]0-i will now ask a certain help of [you]80-kabiyesi . 1 want [you]80-kabiyesi to elect an appropriate personality in addition to [myself]0-i , that [we]549-we may both tour [the entire environs]550-the entire environs and make announcements concerning [this taA of [the Forest of One Thousand]552-the forest of one thousand]551-this taa of the forest of one thousand and Four Hundred Deities ; and [we]549-we must be despatched on the tour immediately even as [many of [[our]549-we seasoned hunters]554-our seasoned hunters]553-many of our seasoned hunters are already bound for [Langbodo]20-langbodo with [Akara - Ogun]109-akara - ogun . [Father of all]559-father of all , live honoured . ’ These were [my]549-we words to [the king]3708-the king and [he]3708-the king rejoiced greatly on hearing them . only deceive [ourselves]549-we thinking [Oyindayepo]107-oyindayepo has departed from [us]549-we , [this one]560-this one will perform greater wonders . ’ Those done , [the king]3708-the king ordered that '[0-i] food be spread before [me]0-i . misconducts in [heaven]447-heaven . When [I]0-i encountered [him]600-this man [he]600-this man was clad in an apron which served as cover for [his]600-this man groin . [I]0-i waited until [he]118-ibembe - olokunrun had devoured the first of the two meats then [I]0-i spoke to [him]118-ibembe - olokunrun a second time , like this : * [my]0-i respect , [Ibembe - Olokunrun]118-ibembe - olokunrun , well done . ’ [He]118-ibembe - olokunrun pretended lo allow [me]118-ibembe - olokunrun to speak , chewed some more and gave [me]118-ibembe - olokunrun one long stare before replying , through the nose : ‘[118-ibembe - olokunrun] A aha ’ , and reached for the second meat . [This man]600-this man took [his]600-this man time and picked the second antelope right to the bone before [he]118-ibembe - olokunrun finally grumbled out aloud thus , ‘[0-i] what is it that [you]0-i want of [me]0-i ? ’ So 1 replied , ‘[0-i] It is [you]118-ibembe - olokunrun [I]0-i have come to seek , it is on [your]118-ibembe - olokunrun account that [I]0-i came hither . [The king of [[my]0-i town]621-my town]620-the king of my town requests [your]118-ibembe - olokunrun assistance for a certain project which wili involve voyaging through a certain spot where numerous fleshy beasts have [their]622-their abode . JOURNEY BEGINS TO [THE MOUNT OF THOUGHT]240-the mount of thought , IN [THE FOREST OF A THOUSAND]634-the forest of a thousand AND [FOUR HUNDRED DEITIES]635-four hundred deities No sooner was [I]0-i done wkh greeting [this visitor of [mine]0-i]636-this visitor of mine m [[his]636-this visitor of mine room]392-his room early in the morning of the next day than word came to [me]0-i that breakfast was ready , so [we]638-we all went to the table to have breakfast . It was the night before yesterday that [I]318-the man arrived [here]3745-here and [we]3916-we had plunged into work right from the moment of [my]318-the man arriving , [we]3916-we worked right through the dusk yesterday which left [me]318-the man only a few leisure hours or [I]318-the man should indeed have strolled round [town]573-town , and in so doing , called at [many of [[your]3910-citizens of this town homes]3919-your homes]3918-many of your homes . ‘[318-the man] [This friend of [mine]649-mine]648-this friend of mine here is someone [you]650-you .must all thank heartily on [my]0-i account , for [he]648-this friend of mine is truly [a good - natured man]651-a good - natured man . [I]0-i want [you]650-you all to rise now and express some thanks to [them]653-themselves . 24

When [the man]318-the man had said this , [[his]318-the man audience]656-his audience rose and addressed [their]656-his audience thanks to [me]0-i . Thereupon [he]318-the man hade [them]656-his audience retake [their]656-his audience seats and [he]318-the man resumed [his]318-the man speech like this : [I]0-i recounted yesterday how [the king of [[my]0-i city]658-my city]657-the king of my city appointed [me]0-i to head [a band of hunters who were preparing for an expedition through [the Forest of]25-the forest of [a Thousand]660-a thousand and Four Hundred Deities to [a notable country on [the outskirts of heaven]662-the outskirts of heaven , the name of which is [Mount Ironu]26-mount ironu]661-a notable country on the outskirts of heaven , the name of which is mount ironu]659-a band of hunters who were preparing for an expedition through the forest of a thousand and four hundred deities to a notable country on the outskirts of heaven , the name of which is mount ironu . [I]0-i relayed as well how [myself]0-i and [a number of [the king]3708-the king ’s men]666-a number of the king ’s men had toured [cities]668-cities and [towns]567-towns abroad in search of [appropriate individuals]670-appropriate individuals for this task . [I]0-i have also narrated how during the course of this campaign [we]664-we came upon [one unique individual whose name [I]0-i gave as [Ibembe - Olokunrun]118-ibembe - olokunrun]671-one unique individual whose name i gave as ibembe - olokunrun , [the man who ate the most of all creatures living]672-the man who ate the most of all creatures living . Now it was not [Ibembe - Olokunrun]118-ibembe - olokunrun alone who came back with [us]664-we from that tour . [We]664-we also brought home [one fellow whose name is [Kumodiran]123-kumodiran , [the Inherited Clubs]674-the inherited clubs]673-one fellow whose name is kumodiran , the inherited clubs . This was an entirely dignified personality in [his]673-one fellow whose name is kumodiran , the inherited clubs own right , even while [his]673-one fellow whose name is kumodiran , the inherited clubs own nature also aspired to the most unusual . On waking up each morning [this man]600-this man awaited [a volunteer who would provide [him]600-this man with six strokes of the club on the back of [his]600-this man neck]676-a volunteer who would provide him with six strokes of the club on the back of his neck . This for [him]600-this man was an early morning routine and a failure to fulfil this simply reduced [him]600-this man to [a dull and pathetically fatigued man]677-a dull and pathetically fatigued man for the rest of the day . First thing in the morning [he]600-this man went out seeking someone who would club [him]600-this man soundly on the neck , six times , [such a fellow]678-such a fellow must also deal [him]600-this man six other strokes on [his]600-this man buttocks and fist [him]600-this man hard on the chest six times . If [you]679-you did not treat [Kumodiran]123-kumodiran in this manner , [he]123-kumodiran complained of aches in [his]123-kumodiran head and neck for an entire day and conducted [himself]123-kumodiran all over [the place]435-the place like [an old man]681-an old man . It was the nature of [his]123-kumodiran parentage which gave [him]123-kumodiran that quality ; [his]123-kumodiran life - story goes like this : In those days [the beasts of [the forest]456-the forest]682-the beasts of the forest had formed a habit of transforming [themselves]682-the beasts of the forest into [human beings]684-human beings , [men]297-men and [women]686-women . 25

and [they]682-the beasts of the forest came up regularly to [the market]687-the market to purchase foodstuffs . [Their]682-the beasts of the forest original skins [they]682-the beasts of the forest would discard and go round [the woods]688-the woods in search of [ghommids whose members resembled tnose of [men]297-men]689-ghommids whose members resembled tnose of men . When [they]682-the beasts of the forest took an arm from one ghommid , [they]682-the beasts of the forest took the feet from another and loaned the trunk from yet another . [They]682-the beasts of the forest pieced all of these together until [they]682-the beasts of the forest had assumed the perfect human form . Once upon a time , the elephant came up in the likeness of [a man]312-a man and the leopard also came in the form of [a woman]692-a woman . [These two people]693-these two people took a liking to [each other]331-each other at first sight and [they]693-these two people agreed afterwards to be joined in wedding . [The man]318-the man hired [a house]696-a house on a monthly rent , and it was there that [they]693-these two people met on market days which wa§ every nine days . There was such great understanding between [this couple]697-this couple for a whole year , [the one]698-the one thinking [the other]699-the other to be [a real human being]700-a real human being . The long and short of this all was that the elephant made the leopard pregnant and [the child that was borne [him]701-the child that was borne him]701-the child that was borne him was the Inherited [Clubs]124-clubs . [Kumodiran]123-kumodiran was [a beautiful man]702-a beautiful man and extremely powerful ; tall [he]123-kumodiran was and stocky , [I]0-i have never known or heard of anyone felling [him]123-kumodiran in wrestling . [His]123-kumodiran arms were the lengthy arms of [[his]123-kumodiran father]419-his father but what [he]123-kumodiran inherited from [[his]123-kumodiran mother]704-his mother was swiftness — [Kumodiran]123-kumodiran resembled [[his]123-kumodiran parents]705-his parents to the core . Also , [he]123-kumodiran was a great talent in hunting for [he]123-kumodiran stampeded as many animals with [his]123-kumodiran feet as [he]123-kumodiran killed with [his]123-kumodiran gun . This is all that there was to [that individual]706-that individual . [The third noteworthy man who came with [us]708-us]707-the third noteworthy man who came with us was [a fellow called [Ayederu - eda]125-ayederu - eda]709-a fellow called ayederu - eda , [[his]125-ayederu - eda own home - town]710-his own home - town was only a short distance from [ours]708-us . [He]125-ayederu - eda was [husband]711-husband to [one woman called [Inudimeji]126-inudimeji]712-one woman called inudimeji and [she]712-one woman called inudimeji was from [the house of [Iberuparapo]27-iberuparapo]713-the house of iberuparapo . It was this same period when [we]708-us entered [the town]438-the town that fire caught [the entire house of [Iberuparapo]27-iberuparapo]715-the entire house of iberuparapo and razed it to the ground ; this singular mishap was not to deter [Ayederu - eda]125-ayederu - eda from giving [uS]716-us a befitting welcome ; [he]125-ayederu - eda took great care of [us]708-us and indulged [us]708-us with various presents . Hardly had [this man]600-this man heard of [our]708-us arrival when [he]125-ayederu - eda purchased a whole box of bottled wine and two large cows and made presents of them to [us]708-us . [He]125-ayederu - eda did 26

not pause [there]718-there , [he]125-ayederu - eda sent [us]708-us twelve sack - loads of yams and pure frothing palm - wine , made [us]708-us trample on gari , sacks of yamflour , eight giant gallons of kernel oil and outsized sachets of salt . [I]0-i indulged in rituals until [I]0-i had sacrificed six live horses , [I]0-i offered six snails in sacrifice to [my]0-i head , sacrificed six fowls on the altar of sigidi and slaughtered six rams in [the backyard]311-the backyard , but sixty goats did 1 provide in offering on the crossroads . [The fourth person on the roll]811-the fourth person on the roll was [a man called [Ewe - eye]130-ewe - eye]812-a man called ewe - eye , [an experienced herbalist from [the far West]814-the far west]813-an experienced herbalist from the far west . [[His]827-the fifth mother]704-his mother , [an uncommonly attractive woman in [her]704-his mother teen - age]834-an uncommonly attractive woman in her teen - age decided to go and pay [[her]704-his mother father]835-her father a visit on [[his]835-her father farm]836-his farm ; [she]704-his mother embarked on this journey during a season of the Oro festival . [She]704-his mother planned to retreat at once but was awaited by the same sound from the rear . The impression that this created was that [the terrible masquerade]839-the terrible masquerade was approaching from both back and front , so that [she]704-his mother soon deviated from [the lane]840-the lane and forsook [her]704-his mother path to flee into [the forest]456-the forest . When the sound eventually died down . 31

[she]704-his mother found that [she]704-his mother could no longer retrace [her]704-his mother way to [the road]3702-the road , even so did [she]704-his mother get lost , wandering and seeking [her]704-his mother lost path futilely in [the woods]688-the woods . [Nightfall]136-nightfall caught [this woman]849-this woman in [the wood]850-the wood and it was in the course of [her]704-his mother vain wanderings that [she]704-his mother encountered a ghommid whose home was in [the cragged rocks]851-the cragged rocks . [He]852-he possessed four eyes , two noses and two mouths . In the centre of [his]852-he head were two large horns which resembled the antlers of the buffalo . [The ghommid]853-the ghommid decided that [he]853-the ghommid would not harm [this woman]849-this woman , instead [he]853-the ghommid took [her]849-this woman with [him]853-the ghommid to [[his]853-the ghommid home]578-his home in [the crevices of rocks]856-the crevices of rocks and made [her]849-this woman [[his]853-the ghommid wife]245-his wife . The ways of [the ghommid]853-the ghommid can not always conform with those of [humans]862-humans , before long a quarrel broke out between [this couple]697-this couple and [the man]318-the man sent [[his]318-the man wife]245-his wife packing . Wherever [a man]312-a man wished to see on [this earth]3703-this earth , and regardless of its distance , [he]312-a man was only required to peer through that hole and [the place]435-the place would come into view at once . [Filasayepo]137-filasayepo [himself]137-filasayepo lived [his]137-filasayepo boyhood in [hell]886-hell 32

for [[his]137-filasayepo father]419-his father had turned [him]137-filasayepo over to [Satan]138-satan for proper training since [he]137-filasayepo was only [a child]482-a child . This was tfie reason why [the man]318-the man ’s eyes turned to red kernels and [his]318-the man body assumed the blackness of the cooking pot . The wondrous thing about [the youth]893-the youth was that , [his]318-the man character soon waxed too strong for [the devil]3803-the devil . When [the devil]3803-the devil sent [him]318-the man on a devious errand , [he]318-the man ran the very opposite of what errand [he]318-the man has been sent to run . who accompanied [Akara - Ogun]109-akara - ogun to [Mount Langbodo]19-mount langbodo]914-a relative of olohun - iyo 33 who accompanied akara - ogun to mount langbodo that other time . [This man]600-this man danced better than the insect ; [his]600-this man flute brought such melodies that whenever [he]600-this man played it , [both man]916-both man and beast danced [themselves]916-both man to near paralysis . Now [you]911-you have heard the names of [the most important nine amongst [us]918-us]917-the most important nine amongst us . 1 shall not give [you]911-you the names of [the rest forty - one]919-the rest forty - one because time is flying . [Everyone of [us]918-us]920-everyone of us held a gun except [Mr. Sugarcane]140-sugarcane who insisted that [his]140-sugarcane weapon was [his]140-sugarcane flute ; [he]140-sugarcane played [us]918-us melodious tunes on [the road of [Elegbeje]73-elegbeje]921-the road of elegbeje , so that [our]918-us voyage itself might brew sweetness , like the juice of the sugarcane . When [those hunters]922-those hunters had all taken position , [they]922-those hunters were a spectacle for pride and envy . [They]922-those hunters stood in readiness like [men who reposed [their]923-men who reposed their faith in god faith in [God]106-god]923-men who reposed their faith in god ; [these men]924-these men were hardened in [their]924-these men resolutions like the spice of rock from the crag , [their]924-these men minds had sprouted wings , [their]924-these men minds had taken flight from [the home of regress]925-the home of regress , finding refuge on [the outskirt of heaven]926-the outskirt of heaven . [The sons of men who took one glance at [them]922-those hunters]927-the sons of men who took one glance at them blew [their]927-the sons of men who took one glance at them cheeks with smiles , [they]927-the sons of men who took one glance at them picked up a significant lesson here that it is not in the ways of [the Lord]928-the lord to refuse [men]297-men [their]297-men hearts ’ desires , except of course if such desires would be of an ultimaite harm to [them]297-men . [He]3954-he who moulded [this universe]3955-this universe , spacious as it is , and places [man]3733-man above all things , has achieved the zenith of goodness . This was how it occurred : [Il]146-il so happened that [we]1064-we heard a mysterious voice raise itself up suddenly from [the forest]456-the forest , a very loud voice , and it began to hawk some curiou.s wares thus , ‘ [Dwellers ol [the forest]456-the forest]4000-dwellers ol the forest , [pilgrims of the road]4002-pilgrims of the road , hasten here and buy from [me]146-il . [My]146-il wares are numerous but the price is little . Epilepsy costs only ten pounds , small - pox two pounds , leprosy four pounds , lunacy six pounds , head - ache ten shillings , pain.s of the feet six shillings , boils twelve pence , stomach - ache ten shillings , elephantiasis one pound , cold three pence , diarrhea a pound and hall , craw - craw three pence , cough one pound , lever seven shillings , worms are fifteen shillings each etc . etc . complexion but [her]1069-her shoulders were burdened by two enormous wings which swerved backwards . [mis - self - conductors]1097-mis - self - conductors , [mis - ealers]1098-mis - ealers , [rais - drinkers]1099-rais - drinkers , [conspirators]1100-conspirators , [gossip - peddlers]1101-gossip - peddlers , [unyielding squabbhng maggots]1102-unyielding squabbhng maggots , [sinners]1103-sinners , [liars , nincompoops , cut - throats]1104-liars , nincompoops , cut - throats , [rogues]1105-rogues , empty - minded , thoughtless , weak and wobbling pairs of limbs- can [you]1106-you not see that [you]1106-you have no voice to raise where [we]1107-we are speaking ? Toward what consequence do [you]1106-you conduct [your]1106-you lives ? Tell [me]0-i , [you]1106-you who plot intrigues daily amongst [yourselves]1106-you ! To what end do [you]1106-you direct [your]1106-you existence ? Ingrates ! Can [you]1106-you not see how [you]1106-you burst rocks which are a hundred times mightier than [you]1106-you ? [[We]1116-we who have known what ass - headed fellows [you]1106-you are]1117-we who have known what ass - headed fellows you are care very little about [you]1106-you ; it is [your]1106-you crooked ways which berate [you]1106-you so in [our]1116-we eyes ’ . head in melancholy , and all [[my]0-i friends]3961-my friends with [me]0-i ; [we]1119-we simply retracted back to [[our]1119-we road]1120-our road and trudged on , weakened in [our]1119-we strides . expedition ; [he]152-gongosutakiti had become [a blind man]1133-a blind man , [we]1134-we had to support [him]152-gongosutakiti hence by the arm through thickets and numerous networks ot creepers which covered the route of [our]1134-we voyage . beings]4064-these 46 beings were neither draped in shirts nor trousers , [they]1164-their were decked by [yeri and cowries shells]1165-yeri and cowries shells . demanded to know the hiding of [[his]156-el^bara colleagues]1177-his colleagues . Even so did [Ayederu]125-ayederu - eda point in [my]0-i direction where [I]0-i lay behind the leaves . [He]853-the ghommid cast a second club and it fell in [my]0-i front , vet [I]0-i did not utter a word . But the third hit [my]0-i nose . [He]853-the ghommid sped like wave and [I]0-i raced like the antelope ; [he]853-the ghommid sought food but [I]0-i fled from death . On seeing this , [he]853-the ghommid withdrew from chasing [me]0-i and sought to recapture [Ayederu]125-ayederu - eda . was as though [the creatures of [the forest]456-the forest]1192-the creatures of the forest were mourning [their]1192-the creatures of the forest dead . For [my]0-i own part , [I]0-i simply clung to [my]0-i tree and began to contemplate the visage of [the earth]296-the earth . Not long afterwards , [he]853-the ghommid re - emerged and reached for the tree on which [I]0-i was perched , peered upwards and down but failed to spot [me]0-i . [He]853-the ghommid rampaged through the shrubs and turned upwards once again but [I]0-i was securely masked by the dense foliage . [He]853-the ghommid then turned [his]853-the ghommid back and began to head down [the road]3702-the road . Had [I]0-i the slightest guess that [he]853-the ghommid would return soon enough , [I]0-i would have dismounted immediately to hold a conversation with [my]0-i heels but [I]0-i sat still . And after a brief further wandering , [he]853-the ghommid turned back suddenly and made directly for [[my]0-i tree]1196-my tree . [He]853-the ghommid raised [his]853-the ghommid head and behold , [he]853-the ghommid spotted [me]0-i ! There [I]0-i was , perched right above [his]853-the ghommid eyes ! When [he]853-the ghommid perceived that [I]0-i would need some persuading getting down , [he]853-the ghommid entwined [himself]853-the ghommid to the girth of the tree and began to shake the tree hoping that [I]0-i should lose [my]0-i hold and fall off but the matter did not turn out the way [he]853-the ghommid wished it . In fact , [my]0-i own initial thinking was that [he]853-the ghommid had not really caught sight of [me]0-i but was merely shaking the tree to see if [I]0-i was there . That made [me]0-i to hold [my]0-i peace for a while and [I]0-i refused to shift from [my]0-i place . But when [the man]318-the man noticed that [I]0-i was silent still , [he]318-the man pointed [his]318-the man finger at [me]0-i and said , ‘ Look at the sky and downward , [I]318-the man have seen [you]0-i , [you]0-i are within [my]318-the man hold already ’[318-the man] . Hearing this , [I]0-i found that it was no use pretending so 1 rose on [my]0-i feet and began to climb downwards . Half - way , [I]0-i applied all [my]0-i strength and jumped but it was in [his]853-the ghommid front that [I]0-i found [myself]0-i . [He]853-the ghommid threw [himself]853-the ghommid at [me]0-i with such rapidity but before [he]853-the ghommid could land over [me]0-i , [1]313-1 had catapulted to [my]0-i feet and given the motion to [my]0-i legs . Hence did trouble commence [[my]0-i good friends]1199-my good friends , [Elegbara]155-elegbara rushed after [meat]158-meat while [I]0-i flee from slaughter . [I]0-i did not tire at all and [the ghommid]853-the ghommid [himself]853-the ghommid did not pause . When [we]1201-we had raced for quite a while [we]1201-we approached the entrance of [an outsize hole]1202-an outsize hole and unswerving , [1]313-1 dashed directly for [it]1202-an outsize hole , with the least knowledge that it was the den of a lion which [I]0-i embraced . But when the lion within observed how [1 charged inside it]1204-1 charged inside it mistook 49

[me]0-i for [Elegbara]155-elegbara and avoided [me]0-i and when [Elegbara]155-elegbara [himself]155-elegbara emerged , it decided that [he]155-elegbara was [the man]318-the man and began to tug at [him]155-elegbara . [They]1206-they were thus locked in wrestling and [1]313-1 chanced on this to retrace [my]0-i steps back to the open to get some speed . [I]0-i was yet to clear much space however when [Elegbara]155-elegbara tore the lion into two and resumed [his]155-elegbara race behind [me]0-i . Thereafter [we]1208-we approached the brim of a very deep torrent ; [the man]318-the man began to grin to [himself]318-the man here thinking that here at last was the occasion to corner [me]0-i . But on reaching [the bank]1210-the bank , [I]0-i flew directly into [the deep]1211-the deep , preferring to drown than to be slaughtered . This made [the ghommid]159-the ghommid to tuck the finger of disappointment in [his]318-the man mouth , [he]318-the man folded [his]318-the man arms and watched in silence . [He]318-the man did not bother to pierce [the water]1212-the water or pursue [me]0-i any further , instead [he]318-the man snapped [his]318-the man fingers at [me]0-i , hissed and returned to [the forests]1152-the forests to resume [his]318-the man travels . By the time [I]0-i arrived on [the other side of this river]1214-the other side of this river [I]0-i had become completely exhausted , only a small quantity of breath remained inside of [me]0-i . [I]0-i slumped and stretched out resting all [my]0-i weak members , and it so happened that it was this same moment that [God]106-god chose to fan a most desired cold air over [the entire environs]550-the entire environs . For this reason therefore [I]0-i stilled [myself]0-i on the ground where [I]0-i lay and released [myself]0-i to sheer contentment under this unique breeze . [I]0-i had not been resting for long when [a remarkably beautiful lady]1216-a remarkably beautiful lady rose up from an angle and came up towards [me]0-i . [I]0-i tell [you]1217-you , mere words can hardly describe the beauty of [this woman]849-this woman . [She]849-this woman was garbed in a smart dress and was shining with tidiness and freshness ; [her]849-this woman teeth were plastic white and the clarity of [her]849-this woman eyes was the very suggestion of moonlight . Moderately shaped [she]849-this woman was , standing , and held a shawl in [her]849-this woman hand ; a pair of ear - rings hung down [her]849-this woman cheeks , [her]849-this woman feet were adorned by court slippers made from brass . [She]849-this woman was [herself]849-this woman a shiny black in complexion , but [hers]849-this woman was the epitome of an enviable blackness . [This woman]849-this woman had scarcely taken notice of [me]0-i when [she]849-this woman burst into a smile and began to converse with [me]0-i . [She]849-this woman asked how it was that [I]0-i came to be in that place on [my]0-i own at that time and 1 50

narrated to [her]849-this woman the entire tale of [our]1220-our recent encounters . [She]849-this woman smiled with [me]0-i with great ease and comforted [me]0-i with [her]849-this woman very presence for before [her]849-this woman arrival , [my]0-i mind had been in a state of distress , [I]0-i had in fact begun to wonder why [I]0-i had barred [Efegbara]160-efegbara from devouring [me]0-i . [The woman]868-the woman rose after a while and fetched [me]0-i a cup of water . This water was ten times colder than [the water of [the river]341-the river]1222-the water of the river and when [she]868-the woman perceived that [I]0-i was greatly exhausted , [she]868-the woman departed from [me]0-i again to bring [me]0-i medicines in a bottle , poured [me]0-i some in a glass cup and [I]0-i drank . No sooner had [I]0-i drunk the medicine than a new vitality flooded [my]0-i body . And it was only after [1]0-i had recovered [my]0-i lost energy thus that [I]0-i turned to [her]868-the woman and began to hold a proper conversation with [her]868-the woman . [She]868-the woman confided to [me]0-i that [[her]868-the woman mother]1224-her mother was [a human being]832-a human being but it was to a ghommid that [she]868-the woman delivered [her]868-the woman . [I]0-i heard also that [this bog - troll]1226-this bog - troll , [[her]868-the woman father]835-her father , was [the king of [the region where [we]1230-we were]1229-the region where we were]1228-the king of the region where we were , so [she]868-the woman enjoined [me]0-i to come with [her]868-the woman and know [[[her]868-the woman father]835-her father ’s place]1232-her father ’s place which [she]868-the woman said was only a short distance but [I]0-i declined . [I]0-i declared that [my]0-i purpose in that hour was to catch a brief rest and that [I]0-i was really on [my]0-i way back to [the other side of the river]1233-the other side of the river to be with [[my]0-i companions]1234-my companions . Thereupon [she]868-the woman asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i already had [a wife]1235-a wife and [I]0-i replied that [I]0-i had none and that such a thought as [women]686-women had not yet occurred to [me]0-i : [my]0-i sole concern for the moment was this mission to the Mount of Thought in [the Forest of]25-the forest of [a Thousand and Four Hundred Deities]3870-a thousand and four hundred deities . [My]0-i own thinking at this point was that [this lady]1238-this lady was expressing [her]1238-this lady interest in [me]0-i . It was not as if [she]1238-this lady put that into words , but this was [my]0-i own reading of [her]1238-this lady so far . For [they]1239-they are very few indeed among [[our]1240-our female folks]1241-our female folks who can look [a man]312-a man in the face and confess that [they]1239-they are interested in [him]312-a man . Not even if [that man]1243-that man ’s love intoxicated [them]1239-they like hot wine or possessed [them]1239-they as the spirit of [a deity]1244-a deity possesses [his]312-a man vestals . [The lady]858-the lady took great care of [me]0-i and it was [her]858-the lady affair which led [me]0-i to the conclusion that affection begets atfection ; for before this time , [I]0-i had developed a very stern attitude towards [51

women]1246-51 women . [I]0-i believe that it was [my]0-i own nature which disagreed with those creatures and persisted in locking [them]1246-51 women out of [my]0-i mind . When the moment came for [me]0-i to part with [this one]560-this one , [I]0-i found to [my]0-i utter surprise that [I]0-i was very near to tears , even though [I]0-i had up till this point not conceived the slightest idea about befriending [her]858-the lady , much less consider making [her]858-the lady [my]0-i wdfe . [[Her]858-the lady father]835-her father ’s name was [Ajedubule]161-ajedubule , [he]835-her father was [the immediate elder brother of [the father of [Filasayepo]137-filasayepo]1260-the father of filasayepo]1259-the immediate elder brother of the father of filasayepo . [He]137-filasayepo had hardly allowed [me]0-i to sit when [we]1262-we both floated up into the high skies and 52

began to fly away . This manner of flight scared [me]0-i a little at first but [I]0-i soon overcame [my]0-i fear and settled [myself]0-i in comfort on the back of the spirit . [I]0-i grabbed at the fur of [his]137-filasayepo body and clung tight to the hunch of [his]137-filasayepo back lest [I]0-i should fall off . But on close observation , [I]0-i detected the absence of [one man]959-one man from [our]1283-we midst , [his]959-one man name was [Igbin - eniyan]162-igbin - eniyan or [the Human Snail]1286-the human snail . It was the nature of [this man]600-this man which earned [him]600-this man [his]600-this man name for [he]600-this man was [an extremely slow person]1288-an extremely slow person in all [his]600-this man undertakings . When [he]600-this man took [his]600-this man stroll [he]600-this man could not be hurried , likewise did [he]600-this man prefer to take [his]600-this man time when [he]600-this man spoke ; urgency was a total stranger to [him]600-this man . [[our]1283-we man]1295-our man apparently and had torn [him]1295-our man to shreds ; [we]1283-we espied [Elegbara]155-elegbara with [our]1283-we own eyes blowing air through the skull oi [[our]1283-we beloved comrade]1296-our beloved comrade , [the Human Snail]164-the human snail . [Ibembe - Olokunrun]118-ibembe - olokunrun was [the only man of the lot]1297-the only man of the lot who did not procure any bruise and this was a wonder to [us]1283-we all . A [THE TOWN OF [EDIDARE]7-edidare WHERE DOUBLE - FOOLISHNESS]31-the town of edidare where double - foolishness IS [KING]165-king OVER [THEM]1305-them [We]1283-we left [the town of beasts]1306-the town of beasts and covered more distance in the direction of [our]1283-we goal before [we]1283-we came across a path branching to the left . Observable on this spot was a sign - post which conveyed this message , ‘ [The Town of [Edidare]7-edidare where [king Double - foolishness]4069-king double - foolishness rules upon [them]1305-them]4068-the town of edidare where king double - foolishness rules upon them . ’[165-king] These words were an astonishment for [us]1283-we but [we]1283-we turned [our]1283-we feet into [the path]1307-the path all the same , resolving to know what [the place]435-the place was about . Before long , after [we]1283-we had trekked on [this road]484-this road for a little while [we]1283-we began to catch a glimpse of [the settlement itself ahead of [us]1283-we]1310-the settlement itself ahead of us , but it was with increasing amazement that [we]1283-we found the path to be narrowing as [we]1283-we continued on [it]1307-the path , giving the impression that [no man]3770-no man lived in [the place]435-the place . Soon afterwards , [we]1283-we entered into [[the town]438-the town ’s centre]1314-the town ’s centre . [I]0-i tell [you]1315-you this , [[my]0-i good friends]1199-my good friends , [I]0-i am yet to know any other place on [this earth]3703-this earth which boasts greater filth than [this town of which [I]0-i speak]1318-this town of which i speak , for odours began to bid [us]1283-we welcome long before [we]1283-we had come within view of [the mid - town]1319-the mid - town . It was doubtful whether [any broom]1320-any broom had bothered to sweep [the entire market]1321-the entire market once since eternity . Also , according to [their]1322-they custom , only [the aged]1323-the aged sold things in [the market]687-the market , only [they]1322-they must hawk wares around and yet the number of heads which [we]1283-we counted in [the entire market - place]779-the entire market - place did not surpass fifty , heads which mostly were overtaken by the grey - hair . [[Their]1322-they population]1326-their population would indeed have been more than this but for the fact that [they]1322-they died early in [the town]438-the town . [They]1322-they displayed [their]1322-they wares on garbage heaps , strutted about in the open naked and bathed only once in three years . For this reason filth covered [the entire citizenry]1328-the entire citizenry from [their]1328-the entire citizenry heads to [their]1328-the entire citizenry feet , to such an extent that crumbs of dirt dropped off from [their]1328-the entire citizenry bodies when [they]1328-the entire citizenry walked past . This , to [my]0-i mind , was the reason why craw - craw was of such great abundance in [the place]435-the place . Even so , that which [they]1322-they possessed and which sur- 55

passed [craw - craw]32-craw - craw was the sore ol [the Icel]33-the icel , deep and fluid - soaked sores which stood as fashion for [the nobility]1330-the nobility . Slim leaves could not suffice to cover them and liquids dripped out ol [them]1322-they al regular intervals . [Lice]166-lice and bugs of assorted kinds took reluge in [their]166-lice clothes and heads , those insects had camped on [their]166-lice bodies in such large numbers because [they]166-lice found exceeding comfort on [them]1322-they . There was scarcely a spot on the skin of [the people of [Edidare]7-edidare]1331-the people of edidare which [jigger]1332-jigger had not yet punctured ; [jiggers]1333-jiggers raised [storey ­ buildings]1334-storey ­ buildings on the soles of [their]1333-jiggers feet and built bungalows on [their]1333-jiggers buttocks , but [lice]1335-lice constructed [[their]1335-lice own palaces]1336-their own palaces on [their]1335-lice skulls . [Their]1335-lice fingernails were sharper than matchets , so much that when [they]1335-lice scratched [their]1335-lice bodies the sound of [their]1335-lice scratching resembled that of the hoe ploughing forests . Drinking water in [the place]435-the place was a matter for sadness for even while [they]1335-lice had [a very small stream up and down [the town]438-the town]1338-a very small stream up and down the town , it was even [there]718-there that [they]1335-lice directed [their]1335-lice excrements . After [we]1341-we had taken note of [the marketplace]788-the marketplace and beheld [their]1335-lice ways which was as unspeakable as [I]0-i have just outlined , [we]1341-we resolved amongst [[our]1341-we fellows]1343-our fellows that [we]1341-we would pitch [tent]1344-tent nearby and observe [this people]1345-this people even more for a couple of - days . [The space which [we]1341-we appropriated for this purpose]1346-the space which we appropriated for this purpose was only a fifteen minutes walk from [the township]1347-the township ; [we]1341-we were careful to pick [a spot of such considerable distance]1348-a spot of such considerable distance because [we]1341-we wished to be detached from [the natives]1349-the natives as much as possible . What was most unseemly about [this people]1345-this people was [their]1345-this people conduct amongst [themselves]1345-this people . According to [their]1345-this people judgement , life belonged to [the youths]1351-the youths , [the elder]1352-the elder counted for nothing . In the morning [the father]1353-the father went round [the compound]1354-the compound in search of [[his]1353-the father children]470-his children and prostrated [himself]1353-the father before [each one of [them]470-his children]1356-each one of them in salutation . [Mothers]3887-mothers greeted [[their]3887-mothers daughters]1358-their daughters also kneeling . It was [the youth]893-the youth who sent [elders]475-elders on errands and when [elders]475-elders and [young ones]1362-young ones dined together it was mandatory for [the elder]1352-the elder to wash the plates after . [Women]686-women engaged in the most strenous tasks excepting once in a long while when [[their]686-women men]1365-their men gave [them]686-women a helping hand . [The women]1366-the women cultivated [the land]1367-the land and when [their]1366-the women 56

yams were ripe , [they]1366-the women ploughed [them]1368-them up and placed [them]1368-them over the heads of [[their]1366-the women husbands]1369-their husbands to transport [home]387-home . When [a young man]1371-a young man carried something of considerable weight in [his]1371-a young man hand and emerged in [the street]3901-the street , [the elders]3969-the elders scrambled to [their]3969-the elders feet and took it from [him]1371-a young man . Also , when [old folks]1374-old folks took [[their]1374-old folks children]1375-their children to [the farm]433-the farm , [the old ones]1377-the old ones bore the loads back to [the house]319-the house . And even while on [the farm]433-the farm [the most elderly]1380-the most elderly gathered straws together to make fire and cook with [them]1380-the most elderly . [The citizens of [Edidare]7-edidare]1381-the citizens of edidare never buried [their]1381-the citizens of edidare dead . Whenever one of [them]1381-the citizens of edidare dropped dead , food had arrived ! For [they]1381-the citizens of edidare feasted on [their]1381-the citizens of edidare dead bodies in [the town]438-the town . Even so [they]1381-the citizens of edidare never deliberately seize hold of [anyone alive]1383-anyone alive to kill for food , [they]1381-the citizens of edidare usually ensured that [a man]312-a man has actually given up . the ghost before [they]1381-the citizens of edidare set about hacking [him]312-a man apart . When [a number of [them]1381-the citizens of edidare]1385-a number of them died at a go , [they]1381-the citizens of edidare stored [their]1381-the citizens of edidare bodies in [the backyard]311-the backyard and picked [them]1380-the most elderly up one after another until [they]1381-the citizens of edidare exhausted [their]1381-the citizens of edidare stock . And even while it is the truth that [they]1381-the citizens of edidare spread [their]1381-the citizens of edidare meat over fire to roast before [they]1381-the citizens of edidare ate [them]1380-the most elderly , [they]1381-the citizens of edidare had yet to know the advantage of seasoning meat for the purpose of preservation , so that when [they]1381-the citizens of edidare had stored bodies for three days and perceived that those were beginning to decay , [they]1381-the citizens of edidare sent out word to [[their]1381-the citizens of edidare neighbours]535-their neighbours and invited [them]535-their neighbours to a big feast saying , ‘ [we]1381-the citizens of edidare are making offering , so that [God]106-god might endow [us]1381-the citizens of edidare with longevit/. [They]1381-the citizens of edidare possessed also a most unusual idea about the construction of [houses]4070-houses ; all [[their]1381-the citizens of edidare houses]4071-their houses lacked windows , to such extent that free air was denied passage through [them]4071-their houses and [[their]1381-the citizens of edidare roomlets]4072-their roomlets remained in perpetual darkness . Weeds [they]1381-the citizens of edidare had for roofing and when rain fell flood overtook [the homesteads]4073-the homesteads and the floors of [rooms]4074-rooms were drenched wet . [They]1381-the citizens of edidare spread leaves on the ground in the night to sleep upon and stones served them for pillows , for indeed mats were completely foreign to . them in [the place]435-the place . As [I]1381-the citizens of edidare have recounted to [you]4076-you earlier on , clothes were a rare affair in [this town]3894-this town ; for even while [[their]1388-their compounds]4078-their compounds were usually large irf - siz6 , [an entire household]4079-an entire household might not own more than a 57[1381-the citizens of edidare]

single cloth . Hence [they]1388-their drew up a time - table whereby the cloth came to [each member of [the compound]1354-the compound]1389-each member of the compound on specified days of the week . For instance , if [the inhabitants of [a house]696-a house]1391-the inhabitants of a house approached thirty , the cloth was available to [each person]1393-each person only once in a month . As a result of this , [they]1388-their plucked leaves during the harmattan season and used them in place of coverlets . Doubtless [you]1394-you would have begun to guess that [a land which encompassed such a large quantity of filth must harbour within it a considerable amount of [sick people]1396-sick people]1395-a land which encompassed such a large quantity of filth must harbour within it a considerable amount of sick people . There is [no single place on [this earth]3703-this earth whose diseases out - number those of [the town of [Edidare]7-edidare]1399-the town of edidare where Doubled - foolishness was king over [them]1400-them]1397-no single place on this earth whose diseases out - number those of the town of edidare where doubled - foolishness was king over them . Even if [we]1401-we place the matter of the filth aside , how are [we]1401-we to render account for [their]1388-their complete lack of windows or for the damp floors of [[their]1388-their houses]4071-their houses ? What should give more ill - health to [a man]312-a man than these things ? The history of [the town]438-the town which [we]1401-we gathered went thus : [A large city]1405-a large city indeed was [this town]3894-this town in the days of old , it took a whole three days to trek from one end of [it]3894-this town to another . But what brought such regress to it was the absence of unity amongst [[its]3894-this town inhabitants]1407-its inhabitants . [Individualists]1408-individualists [they]1388-their were , [everyone of [them]1388-their]1409-everyone of them , such that there had been [none of [their]1388-their kind]1410-none of their kind before [their]1388-their time and neither would [any such come to be in the hereafter]1411-any such come to be in the hereafter . [Envy]167-envy had such firm roots inside it that [a father]548-a father ensured that [he]548-a father disclosed nothing to [[his]548-a father son]3771-his son ; [mothers]3887-mothers barred [[their]3887-mothers own daughters]1415-their own daughters from observing how [they]3887-mothers made [their]3887-mothers soup . The consequence of this being simply that — what [one man]959-one man knew was not available to [[his]959-one man neighbour]345-his neighbour , and so did [their]1388-their wisdom perish . Some time had gone by after [our]1418-we arrival in [this town]3894-this town before [we]1418-we decided to know [[their]1388-their king]1420-their king in person .
