thought for one moment . 1 give [you]1537-you this assurance this day , that - [I]0-i am yet to know [any other place more disgusting than [this town]3894-this town]1542-any other place more disgusting than this town ; [the world]293-the world has tilted past this present course on which [you]1537-you tread and [you]1537-you must retreat into [yourself]1537-you and make fresh plans lest progress should elude [you]1537-you forever . [We]1579-we had been seated for a while before [the king]3708-the king sent [[his]3708-the king most senior wife]1581-his most senior wife to [us]1579-we , instructing [her]1581-his most senior wife to conduct [us]1579-we round the interior of [[his]3708-the king house]3896-his house . yet surfaced . TRIPLE - FOOLISHNESS ASCENDS TO THE THRONE , SMALL - POX SNATCHES DOUBLE - FOOLISHNESS AWAY This was where [[my]0-i visitor]3751-my visitor paused for the day and [we]1738-we all retired to rest , greeted [all who have assembled and bade [them]1756-all who have assembled and bade them go home to return again early the following morning go [home]387-home to return again early the following morning]1756-all who have assembled and bade them go home to return again early the following morning . Let [US]1738-we proceed . . The attitude of [the people of [Edidare]7-edidare]1331-the people of edidare to the death of [[their]1331-the people of edidare king]1420-their king was a great astonishment for [me]3751-my visitor . When [I]3751-my visitor visited [[the king]3708-the king s place]4137-the king s place , [I]3751-my visitor met [all the townspeople]4138-all the townspeople making merry and when asked the cause of [their]4138-all the townspeople jubilation from [a fellow close by]4139-a fellow close by , [he]4139-a fellow close by replied [me]3751-my visitor like this , ‘[3751-my visitor] [we]1762-we are all rejoicing because this is meat m abundance ; the buttocks of Double - foolishness is fleshy , [his]1763-his belly is rotund and bulky , [he]1763-his is [himself]1763-his robust from [his]1763-his shoulders to the calves of [his]1763-his legs , the meat of [his]1763-his buttocks will not fail to ooze delicious juices into [our]1762-we mouths ’ . [None ol [these people]4141-these people]4140-none ol these people desired death for [himself]1763-his , but [each one of [them]4141-these people]1356-each one of them awaited the demise of [[his]1763-his neighbour]345-his neighbour ; it was [a uniquely evil town]4144-a uniquely evil town . [Those people]1816-those people were indeed [slaves to food]1817-slaves to food . [I]0-i had never heard this pledge [myself]0-i before this time , [I]0-i shall recite it for [you]1818-your and [you]1818-your shall in turn recite after [me]0-i : T believe in food , [he]3708-the king is [governor of the body]1819-governor of the body . Good food causes the body to shine , gives [you]1818-your a stout bone and makes [your]1818-your blood flow freely in [your]1818-your veins . Bad food brings disease in [your]1818-your feet , indecent meals lead bodies to a premature old age — cheeks puff out pointlessly , eyes become sunken , the pillars of the nostrils are weakened in their base . Also , [your]1818-your legs become as broomsticks , the flesh of the arms turn flabby , [your]1818-your front swells forwards , not commensurate with the rest of [your]1818-your body and [your]1818-your buttocks are flat . Bad food brings [you]1818-your a wrinkled face and [you]1818-your become as [a whole crowd of wizened flesh]1820-a whole crowd of wizened flesh . This was how it happened : [I]0-i had [myself]0-i gone to sleep during this night when [[my]0-i friends]3961-my friends came and stirred [me]0-i awake . On waking up , [I]0-i observed that all about was pitch dark , so [I]0-i asked what was amiss but [[my]0-i companions]1234-my companions waved [me]0-i to be silent and listen to certain sounds coming out of the interior of [the forest]456-the forest , unearthly sounds , more resembling the voices of [a multitude of people in [a market]1990-a market]1989-a multitude of people in a market . [I]2002-i rose and stared straight in the direction of the noise , and after a while , [I]2002-i began to detect a distant flashlight , quite identical to sunlight in its intensity , appearing to cover a particular enclosure in the darkness . [I]2002-i found on close observation that [this enclosure]4186-this enclosure had neither walls nor any other demarcations of [its]4186-this enclosure own , [a square arena , bordered on [all tour edges by the limits of the light]4188-all tour edges by the limits of the light]4187-a square arena , bordered on all tour edges by the limits of the light ; it was a space no bigger than twelve feet in length and in breadth . One was male and [the other]699-the other was [female]4192-female . On the head of [the man]318-the man was a cap which glittered from sparks of diamonds and was of the shape of a crown . before which [he]197-leopard - anger has invoked [Satan]138-satan ’s bull - dog with spells from [the darkest bowels of [earth]339-earth]2104-the darkest bowels of earth . quarters . [His]138-satan teeth were red as blood and in fact it was blood which represented saliva in [his]138-satan mouth . [Endurance]196-endurance broached the subject of [his]196-endurance mission and [Lucifer]139-lucifer promised to supply [him]196-endurance with [labourers]2178-labourers . [He]139-lucifer however suggested that [Endurance]196-endurance should take a look round [hell fir^t]36-hell fir^t , hoping to entertain [him]196-endurance thereby from its varied spectacles . INHERITED LUNACY OF THE HOUSEHOLD OF UNITED FOOLS [We]2288-we turned upon [the road]3702-the road and hasted unswerving towards [the Forest of a Thousand and Four Hundred Deities]241-the forest of a thousand and four hundred deities . Nothing of a great significance raised itself until one unique morning at about ten O'clock when [we]2288-we encountered a branching on the right . [We]2288-we observed a post here with this inscription - THE CITY OF IMMODERATES WHERE [[HIS]196-endurance HIGHNESS]1530-his highness , KING MISDEMEANOUR RULES UPON [THEM]2319-them . The name of [this territdry]2320-this territdry lacked much attraction yet [we]2288-we resolved to set [our]2288-we eyes on it since [we]2288-we could , according to thinking , benefit in terms of a ^ew wisdoms therefrom . [We]2288-we had penetrated this branching for a little while before [we]2288-we began to notice [the township]1347-the township itself in the distance , and as a matter of fact , it was the noise coming from [it]1347-the township much resembling the babbles of [a market]1990-a market which welcomed [us]2288-we as [we]2288-we neared [its]1347-the township outskirts . How [a single town]2323-a single town could produce such a volume of noise began to amaze [us]2288-we - unless of course , and this [we]2288-we did consider , it was confronted by the prospects of a war or other unspeakable excitement . The clamours came to [us]2288-we in such bountiful quantity and by the time [we]2288-we were vamp and heels into midtown it had become difficult to hear [[one]359-one ’s neighbour]2325-one ’s neighbour . Even so , when [you]2326-you took the din apart , [the town]438-the town had [its]438-the town own claims to beauty . [Pleasure cars]2328-pleasure cars and [other motor vehicles]2329-other motor vehicles trod [the roads]2177-the roads and bicycles crowded the edges of [streets]2331-streets . Much of modern values of civilization were contained inside [it]438-the town . The only fault , and an enormous one , was in [their]2332-their excessive regard for timing . This was where it became plain to [me]0-i that whatever it is that [a man]312-a man sets [his]312-a man hands on in [this earth]3703-this earth , but which [he]312-a man does in excess , is not really good enough . [I]0-i had not the slightest guess that even order could produce [its]2335-its own demerits when done in excess , for large as [the town]438-the town was , it was mandatory that all [the citizens]1951-the citizens should dine in the same hour . [Each man]971-each man must lift [his]971-each man morsel at exactly the same moment as [[his]971-each man neighbour]345-his neighbour . When the hour of 105

dinner arrived , a bell was rung and [policemen]2340-policemen took [their]2340-policemen place in [the homesteads]4073-the homesteads to see to the enforcement of that law [The man who missed the timed transfer of morsels]2342-the man who missed the timed transfer of morsels directly placed [himself]2342-the man who missed the timed transfer of morsels at the risk of [the prisons]2343-the prisons . [No one]2252-no one must shed tears unless it was the hour allocated for the purpose . [We]2345-we entered [the town]438-the town at the hour of weeping which accounts for the noise which nearly deafened [us]2345-we on [our]2345-we arrival . Whether [you]2347-you were inspired towards weeping or not , the lawful thing to do at this hour was to stream some tears and give voice to compulsory waihng . [You]2347-you were confronted by a similar fate when the bell of the hour of laughter rang . desist from feasting on such with [the inhabitants of [United Fools]39-united fools]2460-the inhabitants of united fools . To cut it all short , [Filasayepo]137-filasayepo ’s errand spirit flew out to [the lady]858-the lady and brought [me]1234-my companions greetings from [her]858-the lady . [I]0-i was filled with bliss on reading this letter , [I]0-i could not have been more pleased if [I]0-i had been made [a king]486-a king . [I]0-i raced through the lines the first time , re - read them a second time and scanned them all over again the third time . [I]0-i can not in short recall how many times [I]0-i read that note . Hardly satisfied still , [I]0-i passed it on to [[my]0-i comrades]4103-my comrades and [we]4103-my comrades all sat down to analyse the letter together . Nor did even that satisfy [me]0-i , [I]0-i began to question [them]4103-my comrades thus , ‘ would [you]4103-my comrades say [you]4103-my comrades enjoyed the letter ? ’[2518-you] ‘ wouldn ’[2518-you] t [you]2518-you admit for instance that that opening in itself is an indication of [her]2519-she own affection towards [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[2519-she] “ ... ensure that [we]4103-my comrades receive [our]4103-my comrades own share of [[you]2520-you people]4125-you people ’s snacks of merriment ” just imagine that ! ’ ‘[2519-she] If [she]2519-she was truly possessed by [my]0-i affection , would it not have been more appropriate if [she]2519-she said [she]2519-she was longing to see [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[2519-she] [You]2520-you know , what [1]0-i am actually anxious to investigate is whether [she]2519-she will be willing to befriend [me]0-i ’ . ‘[2519-she] Even so [you]2520-you have to admit that [she]2519-she inquired after [my]0-i health ’ . [Worthy compatriots]2527-worthy compatriots , [my]0-i happiness at this stage can not be described with words , [1]313-1 ate a most unusual dinner that evening and was flushed by a great vitality . [I]0-i had [the woman]868-the woman on the 116

peak of [my]0-i mind throughout the day and when [I]0-i slept in the night [she]868-the woman encompassed all [my]0-i dreams . [I]0-i found that [we]2530-we were living together as [man]3733-man and [wife]3763-wife in one of the dreams ; this pleased [me]0-i so much that in the morning [I]0-i approached [[my]0-i companions]1234-my companions and related the dream to [them]1234-my companions . [[My]0-i friends]3961-my friends declared that it was not a particularly favourable dream for , according to [them]3961-my friends , if [we]2530-we lived together in such harmony in the dream [we]2530-we would most certainly be incapable of living together in like manner in actual life . [You]2535-you will [yourselves]2535-you guess what nature of distress should engulf [me]0-i on hearing [their]3961-my friends verdict ; [my]0-i entire body let out heat and [I]0-i could not taste food throughout that day . When even [he]2537-the gentleman did so much as stub [his]2537-the gentleman toes against a stone [I]0-i turned to look in the opposite direction . But [I]0-i dreamed again the night following ; [I]0-i encountered Affection of Significance as in the previous night but [we]2530-we did not wait to behold [each other]331-each other this time before [we]2530-we broke out quarreling , [we]2530-we quarreled so much that in the end [we]2530-we were both despatched in opposite directions ; [she]2539-she turned to face [East]203-east and [I]0-i [the West]46-the west . Most worthy Affection of Significance , First of all , [I]0-i must thank [you]2545-you for [your]2545-you letter which arrived here of late . [I]0-i have no doubt that [you]2545-you have begun [yourself]2545-you to imagine what place [you]2545-you occupy in [my]0-i mind before [I]0-i sought a way to contact [you]2545-you . Only God [Himself]2546-himself can bear witness to how [I]0-i have felt since that moment when [we]2547-we parted on [the bank of [the sea of Memory]2549-the sea of memory]2548-the bank of the sea of memory . [I]0-i have not watched a single day pass since without [my]0-i thinking coming to rest on [you]2545-you , nor hour even for that matter ; [you]2545-you stand clearly on the pinnacle of [my]0-i mind and there shall be no way to dislodge [you]2545-you . Even so , [I]0-i shall wish [you]2545-you to understand that it is not [every woman [I]0-i meet whom [I]0-i regard]2550-every woman i meet whom i regard in this manner , far be it ! [I]0-i have never admired [any woman]2551-any woman before now , not until the event of [our]2547-we meeting that is ; [I]0-i just could not stand the sight of [them]2551-any woman . For this forgive [me]0-i — but it is the plain truth 1 speak . [Your]2545-you case has taken such a clear dimension that 1 have resolved even from this minute that it is good conduct which is called affection , love bears no other name for even if [I]0-i turn hardened of heart to an extent that [I]0-i forget [you]2545-you as [a person]2552-a person , how can [I]0-i possibly forget [your]2545-you kindnesses toward [me]0-i on that day when [Elegbara]155-elegbara chased [me]0-i until [I]0-i fell into [water]2553-water ? And supposing [I]0-i had fallen into the hand of [Elegbara]155-elegbara , would it have been possible for [me]0-i to stand up this day and answer to the name of [Irinkerindo]105-irinkerindo ? Ah , character is affection ; [you]2545-you have through [your]2545-you kind - heartedness cultivated the seed of affection in [me]0-i ! That seed which [you]2545-you sowed .has germinated , has sprouted tendrils and has grown stout branches . Its roots have pierced the very grounds of [my]0-i heart to such extent that [you]2545-you can no longer be severed from [my]0-i thinking . Even as [I]0-i write this letter , [I]0-i am convinced that [you]2545-you are [the inost desirable woman on [earth]339-earth]2554-the inost desirable woman on earth . [Your]2545-you head and neck entices [me]0-i wondrously ; the hair on [your]2545-you head , [your]2545-you finger and toe - nails , [your]2545-you front and back , the'eggs in [your]2545-you eyes , [your]2545-you eye - brows , [your]2545-you teeth which are a shining white and [your]2545-you 118

lips are all embodiments of attraction to [me]0-i . Each of them is more handsome than coral . [I]0-i love [your]2545-you arm and [your]2545-you feet , [I]0-i adore the calves of [your]2545-you legs ; [your]2545-you palms are more succulent than the breast of the canary . When [you]2545-you walk past , [your]2545-you gait is the gait of honour . [I]0-i shall be held captive forever and ever more by the sheer elegance of [[your]2545-you person]2556-your person . [Your]2545-you rising inspires emulation , [your]2545-you voice will lead [many men]2557-many men to wish to speak and when [you]2545-you sit , sitting itself becomes fashion in the eyes of [the fashionable]2558-the fashionable . [Most men on seeing [you]2545-you in the course of a stroll]2559-most men on seeing you in the course of a stroll will wish to partake in strolling for the rest of [their]2559-most men on seeing you in the course of a stroll lives . When [I]0-i had taken a keen glance at [you]2545-you that other day , [I]0-i came to the rapid conclusion that the dress [you]2545-you had on had been cut to match [you]2545-you from birth . [A most important crowned - head]2560-a most important crowned - head will rejoice to be so adorned . [Your]2545-you head - gear embraced the morning sunlight and [I]0-i suffered a full six days dreaming of [your]2545-you shawl . Of course [the tiger]2561-the tiger knows nothing of [his]2561-the tiger own dignity , and neither [the duiker]2562-the duiker — nor [you]2545-you ; [you]2545-you can not fully comprehend the nature of [your]2545-you importance in the sight of [men]297-men . This is how [you]2545-you stand , [[my]0-i most worthy friend]2566-my most worthy friend . Affection of Significance who sowed the seeds of affection into [me]0-i and whose love has mounted [me]0-i presently as [a man]312-a man might mount [a bicycle]2568-a bicycle , conducts [me]0-i all about like [the automobile]2569-the automobile and tosses [me]0-i as it pleases , just as the storm on bush leaves . this affair about [my]0-i deep attachment to [you]2545-you . [My]0-i affectionate Affection of Significance , how will [you]2545-you react to the news that [I]0-i have died an unexpected death ? Once again [I]0-i apologise for being unable to write a reply immediately yesterday , [I]0-i was engaged in some labours for [[my]0-i father]3742-my father at the time the letter came to [me]0-i . . And now with regard to the things [you]105-irinkerindo told [me]0-i , 1 urge [you]105-irinkerindo not to be offended with the reply [I]0-i shall give — the matter can simply not be as [you]105-irinkerindo outlined it at all . 1 had resolved since [my]0-i youth that [I]0-i shall not take [any man]487-any man as [husband]711-husband all through [my]0-i life , and were it not for this resolution of [mine]0-i , it is certain that [I]0-i should have become [a mother]2588-a mother long before now . Affection of Significance . [[My]0-i good friends]1199-my good friends , [I]0-i was covered by sweat when [I]0-i read this note . In the end , and after an attempt to recollect [myself]0-i , [I]0-i asked [him]2604-the fellow who brought her message to go saying [I]0-i shall be getting in touch with [her]2604-the fellow who brought her message in due course . After [the man]318-the man s exit [I]0-i went to [[my]0-i fellows]2606-my fellows and tabled the matter before [them]2606-my fellows . [They]2606-my fellows opined that the reply was not itself a particularly bad one ; [they]2606-my fellows entreated [me]0-i to proceed with [my]0-i previous nature of correspondence with [her]2604-the fellow who brought her message and that [I]0-i should be careful not to allude to the subject anymore . By doing this , [they]2606-my fellows reasoned , [we]2607-our would be getting used to [each other]331-each other more and more and even so shall [our]2607-our liking for [each other]331-each other soar . An occasion could arise in the near future which [I]0-i might deem appropriate for hinting at the idea once again , [you]2610-you ’d never know . [I]0-i accepted [their]2606-my fellows counsel and did precisely as [they]2606-my fellows advised . [We]2607-our exchanged gifts and letters frequently ; whenever [I]0-i killed [game]2611-game [I]0-i sent [her]2604-the fellow who brought her message share and when [she]2604-the fellow who brought her message [herself]2604-the fellow who brought her message made some delicious stew , [she]2604-the fellow who brought her message sent some to [me]0-i . Occasionally , [I]0-i tried to pin - point something with remote reference to [our]2607-our earlier discourse in [my]0-i letters but [she]2604-the fellow who brought her message usually kept [her]2604-the fellow who brought her message silence on them . Even then [I]0-i began to observe how warmer [our]2607-our relations appeared to be growing with each day passing . 122

[I]0-i noted down a couple of lessons from this experience . Firstly , [I]0-i came to understand that unless [a man]312-a man has seen an object with [his]312-a man two eyes and [he]312-a man knows for certain what [he]312-a man has seen , [he]312-a man must not go about broadcasting what [he]312-a man has seen . Secondly , [a man]312-a man must consider it closely and with great caution before [he]312-a man draws [his]312-a man conclusions about [a lady]2614-a lady . [You]2615-you will recall how [I]0-i had met [this woman]849-this woman at [the riverside]2617-the riverside and the nature of [her]849-this woman questions on whether [I]0-i already had [a wife]1235-a wife or not . Is it not enough a cause for surprise that [the same lady]2619-the same lady should now turn [me]0-i down when [I]0-i finally put [my]0-i own interest in [her]849-this woman to words ? Thirdly , [I]0-i came to see that love is a matter for [two persons]2620-two persons and not one ; if [a man]312-a man craves [a woman]692-a woman , no matter the extent of [his]312-a man exertion , if [the woman]868-the woman ’s own craving does not complement [his]312-a man own , matters can not progress in the slight . It is the same with [the woman]868-the woman : regardless of the extent of [her]868-the woman craving , if [the man [she]868-the woman craves]2625-the man she craves is not [himself]312-a man attracted to [her]868-the woman then all [her]868-the woman efforts must end up in futility . Even as [I]0-i craved [this lady]1238-this lady [I]0-i noticed that [her]1238-this lady own liking for [me]0-i was breaking boundaries . One morning , [I]0-i woke up from sleep and [the man [I]0-i first came in contact with]2627-the man i first came in contact with was [Ewe]130-ewe - eye - eye ; [he]2627-the man i first came in contact with was dressed in a pair of blue trousers . And when [I]0-i had peered through [my]0-i wardrope to select some wear for the new day , the cloth which came within reach was a pair of blue trousers which was a part of [my]0-i legacies from [[my]0-i father]3742-my father . And even after the dawn had cleared and sunlight lit up the skies , it revealed a rare hue of blue . And yet this happened to be a day when [I]0-i was expecting a message from [Affection of Significance]2629-affection of significance . Even so it did r ot appear as though this recurrence of the colour of blue was over just yet — when [[her]1238-this lady junior brother]1249-her junior brother arrived with [her]1238-this lady message [I]0-i noticed that [he]1249-her junior brother was [himself]1249-her junior brother dressed in clothes of blue ; on receiving [her]1238-this lady letter [I]0-i was astonished to find its envelope to be of the bluish kind also . In the past [she]1238-this lady would have sent such a note in a white seal . And [you]2631-you will doubtless guess what significance this colour bears ; blue is the colour - symbol of affection . [I]0-i tore the envelope open and even as [I]0-i was doing this , what colour should [123]2632-123

stare at [me]0-i beside this same blue ? The blue of the paper had a somewhat deeper hue than that of the envelope . [She]1238-this lady wrote thus : From the [Rivers of Remembrance]205-rivers of remembrance , [The Recess of [Olokun]112-olokun]44-the recess of olokun , Fifth day of February , Nineteen Hundred and Fifty - two years After the Death of [[our]2633-our Lord]4180-our lord . [Irinkerindo]105-irinkerindo [my]0-i own . In [your]2631-you last letter [I]0-i observed that [you]2631-you brought up again this affair about the possibility of [our]2633-our coming together in the near future . [You]2631-you will recall how [I]0-i confided to [you]2631-you that other time about [my]0-i resolution which [I]0-i made in [my]0-i youth not to [we]2633-our d [any man]487-any man all [my]0-i days . lives in [the House of Wandering]3739-the house of wandering and is journeying presently to [the Mount of Thought]1-the mount of thought in [the Forest of a Thousand and Four Hundred Deities]241-the forest of a thousand and four hundred deities , as [[my]0-i husband]2435-my husband]2763-a ghommid , who lives on the bank of the sea of memory , niece to olokun receives irinkerindo , son of oyindayepo , a man , who 131 lives in the house of wandering and is journeying presently to the mount of thought in the forest of a thousand and four hundred deities , as my husband . [I]0-i am aware also that from this minute [I]0-i depart [[[my]0-i mother]3767-my mother s home]2776-my mother s home and become [mother]2777-mother in [[my]0-i own home]4451-my own home . And if even it occurs that sickness pins 1^ to the ground , that [he]2435-my husband grows old before [his]2435-my husband time and Ids beauty diminishes , so much that [he]2435-my husband no longer swanks with pride on [the street]3901-the street , [my]0-i love for [him]2435-my husband will not waver . [I]0-i vow also that [I]0-i will not own two mouths like the trumpet , saying [I]0-i am off to [the stream]2787-the stream even while [I]0-i am heading for [the farm]433-the farm , calling [someone]1683-someone [[my]0-i relative]2790-my relative even while [he]1683-someone is not related to [me]0-i in the sli^t . [A certain man]1850-a certain man lived [there]718-there who could tell stories all [his]1850-a certain man life without pausing for one minute . [His]1850-a certain man name was Inherited Tales . Let [me]0-i quickly unwrap three of the fables [we]2820-we heard from [this man]600-this man . Inherited Tales . Once upon a time there lived [three men]1561-three men ; the name of the first was [Olowolayemo]163-ojuayedun , the second was Vain - pleasures , [Afeaye]211-afeaye , and the third was [Greed - leans - back]2845-greed - leans - back , [Okanjuwafehinti]112-olokun . [These three men]2846-these three men were [hunters]3867-hunters and [they]2846-these three men often went on hunting expeditions together in [the forest]456-the forest as [a team]2849-a team . Deep inside [the jungle]1162-the jungle one day , [they]2846-these three men came by a ghommid who started to race toward [them]2846-these three men with warning yells of ‘ Death ! ’[112-olokun] ‘ Death ! [Death]114-death ! ‘[112-olokun] Death ! ’ on [his]2851-his lips . [The three men]4516-the three men were astonished to see [this ghommid]1267-this ghommid shouting in this manner and [they]4516-the three men tried to stop [him]1267-this ghommid to ask what precisely it was that [he]1267-this ghommid had on [his]1267-this ghommid trail . [The ghommid]853-the ghommid 134[112-olokun]

replying told [them]2846-these three men that it was [Death]114-death whieh [he]2851-his had just bumped into , and assured [them]2846-these three men alst ) that if [they]2846-these three men [themselves]2846-these three men wished to know [Death]114-death in person [they]2846-these three men should go yonder beneath an Iroko tree and there [they]2846-these three men would find [him]114-death . There is no braveness to match that of [a hunter]326-a hunter , [hunters]3867-hunters are [men of steel]2854-men of steel . [The three men]4516-the three men resolved that [they]4516-the three men would set [their]4516-the three men eyes on [this Death]114-death and so headed for the tree in order to meet [him]114-death but on reaching [there]718-there , rather than meet with the death of [their]4516-the three men expectation , it was twelve huge sackloads of coins [they]4516-the three men were confronted with . And as [they]4516-the three men stood pondering the matter , [a cock crew nearby]2858-a cock crew nearby , suggesting that [a town]3874-a town was just round the corner . [These men]924-these men had indeed been lost for a long time hunting in [the wood]850-the wood without even coming near to the trail ot game . It was [Okanjuwafehinti whom [the lot]1166-the lot fell upon to go to [town]573-town and fetch food]2867-okanjuwafehinti whom the lot fell upon to go to town and fetch food . [Greed]212-greed had scarcely left for [town]573-town when [[his]212-greed two remaining companions]2871-his two remaining companions commenced a seminar on the visible advantages ol [only two men owning all that money]2872-only two men owning all that money . undispulably would emerge [the wealthiest man up and down [the entire country]2877-the entire country]2876-the wealthiest man up and down the entire country . Now to the second ; Once a certain palm - bird made its nest on a corn stalk in [a farm]432-a farm and flew out regularly to seek food . Now [the eldest prince]2961-the eldest prince bought [himself]2961-the eldest prince a mat , wherever [he]2961-the eldest prince wished to go and no matter how distant it was , all [he]2961-the eldest prince needed to do was sit [himself]2961-the eldest prince on the mat and command the mat to take [him]2961-the eldest prince [there]718-there , and it was certain to do this without the trip lasting longer than one minute . [The elder]1352-the elder purchased a giraffe ’s horn , this had a hole plumbed into it from one end to another ; the use of this being that wherever [a man]312-a man wished to see in [this earth]3703-this earth [he]312-a man was only required to glance through the mystery hole and [that place]720-that place would come clear to [him]312-a man . But in [his]2961-the eldest prince own case [the youngest man]2967-the youngest man came back with a fruit , this fruit was very durable and was harder than walnut . No matter how acute a disease was or sickness , all [the sick person]2968-the sick person was required to do was sniff this fruit and [he]2968-the sick person would instantly emerge [a healed person]2969-a healed person . When [they]2957-the three princes all converged at the appointed spot , [each man]971-each man displayed [his]971-each man article before [the rest]2971-the rest ; [the second eldest]2972-the second eldest presented [his]2972-the second eldest horn and explained the use of it . But as [he]2972-the second eldest was doing this , [one of [them]2957-the three princes]2973-one of them suggested that [they]2957-the three princes snatch a brief glimpse of [Ewadapo]215-ewadapo , the very cause of [their]2957-the three princes labours through the horn ’s hole . And when [they]2957-the three princes peeped through the hob , what did [they]2957-the three princes see ? [His]4638-this man your father wishes to see nature is quite unearthly and if [[your]419-his father father]335-your father does not watch out [he]335-your father will kill [him]4638-this man your father wishes to see . [The man who stands in [his]4638-this man your father wishes to see front and betrays the slightest fright [he]4638-this man your father wishes to see deals with an iron blow on the head . ’[245-his wife] Of a sudden , [the woman]868-the woman called out to [[her]868-the woman brother]3133-her brother]4643-the man who stands in his front and betrays the slightest fright he deals with an iron blow on the head . ’ of a sudden , the woman called out to her brother with a very loud voice and a rumbling sound replied [her]868-the woman from the depths , more resembling blasts of thunder , making the whole vicinity to tremble . When [he]3133-her brother emerged in the distance , the ground began to split underneath [him]3133-her brother as [he]3133-her brother trod it ; [all the ghommid - servants]3134-all the ghommid - servants and [maids of [the couple]3136-the couple]3135-maids of the couple vanished into hiding . [His]3133-her brother eyeballs were redder than kernel , [his]3133-her brother beard fanning [him]3133-her brother as [he]3133-her brother walked . [THE TOWN OF FALSEHOOD]249-the town of falsehood [We]3153-we witnessed much with [our]3153-we eyes after leaving [this place]2438-this place but [our]3153-we time is far spent and [we]3153-we can not go into all of them now . to the right hand . [1]313-1 returned and regained [my]0-i former seal and waited . It was even as [I]0-i was retaking [my]0-i seat that [I]0-i saw the contracted wall yawn and the doorway resurfacing . The matter of this door was getting to become a mystery to [me]0-i but [I]0-i resolved that [I]0-i would be patient and beat 151

the recalcitrant nuisance to its own game the next time around . And rarely had [I]0-i permitted the passage to reappear for a third time when [I]0-i rose cutlass in hand and with lightning speed , plunged a foot between the merging walls . This move [I]0-i already made before [I]0-i realised that it was a thoughtless thing to do for the presence of [my]0-i foot in the margin did nothing to deter those walls or to change [their]3244-their minds , they clapped shut on [me]0-i just the same leaving [my]0-i limb trapped in - between . And it was for this reason that [I]0-i resigned [myself]0-i to forced contentment in the state of imprisonment , for [I]0-i was indeed getting to be ashamed of [myself]0-i now . [I]0-i remained on the spot till day - break ; in the morning when [[my]0-i wife]4246-my wife woke , it was a different exit which [she]4246-my wife took to leave [[her]4246-my wife room]3240-her room . It was in this way : it happened again one day that as [I]0-i was walking along in the company of [some fellow hunters]3279-some fellow hunters on [a lonely path]3280-a lonely path a gun was fired at [us]3277-us from a truss in the bush and it lacked very little for the shot to hit [me]0-i . The idea which came into [my]0-i own head at that instant was that [some prospective enemy camp in [the forest]456-the forest]3285-some prospective enemy camp in the forest sponsored this attack and set [their]3285-some prospective enemy camp in the forest agency on [us]3277-us to await [us]3277-us so [I]0-i primed [my]0-i own gun , aimed and fired back . A dead shot was [mine]0-i and it hit the target on the dot . Even as [my]0-i gun roared , a voice cried loudly from the bush , hence , [we]3277-us hurried over yonder and with great amazement did [we]3277-us discover the corpse of [one of [[our]3277-us members]3288-our members]3287-one of our members , [Ojuayedim]219-ojuayedim , [a close associate of [Ayederu - eda]125-ayederu - eda]3289-a close associate of ayederu - eda , perforated by [my]0-i gun - shot . [Ayederu]125-ayederu - eda [himself]125-ayederu - eda was present at this scene and even as [we]3277-us identified the body [he]125-ayederu - eda put wails of accusation against [me]0-i in [his]125-ayederu - eda mouth , calling on [everyone from far and near]3290-everyone from far and near to come and witness to the fact that [I]0-i had committed murder . [He]125-ayederu - eda decried and villified [me]0-i before [the whole group]3291-the whole group , demanding that [I]0-i be put on trial . For this cause [the hierachy of the expedition]3292-the hierachy of the expedition arranged some sort of court - martial before which [I]0-i was arraigned . And since [Ayederu - eda]125-ayederu - eda [himself]125-ayederu - eda was [the most senior of [the lot]1166-the lot]3293-the most senior of the lot , after [me]0-i , it was [he]125-ayederu - eda who chaired the judgement . forward Co the sitting was that [I]0-i was [a die - hard felon who deserved nothing short of death by a firing squad]3295-a die - hard felon who deserved nothing short of death by a firing squad . When [we]3424-we looked up for the first time [he]318-the man had the face of [man]3733-man , and when [we]3424-we looked for a second time [he]318-the man was a lion ’s face , looking up for a third time [he]318-the man was the snarling face of a leopard , the fourth time [he]318-the man was a viper ’s with flaring tongue emitting venoms . This surely was cause enough to frighten [us]3424-we , it was sufficient reason for [us]3424-we to resolve to retreat [home]387-home . [himself]3427-him in [our]3425-we way and drove [us]3425-we back . This proved to be nothing for [one of [[our]3425-we members]3288-our members]3287-one of our members had just shot an antelope so [we]3425-we gave it to [him]4703-the gateman . Not long after this , the infantries of the animals began to surface before [us]3452-our but the manner by which [they]3462-them had resolved to meet [us]3452-our was not anywhere close to what [we]3452-our anticipated . For had not [we]3452-our indeed expected that powerful beasts like elephants , lions and leopards would be at the lead of the onslaught ? But no , the theories of those creatures had been of an entirely different kind . It was tiny tiny things like mouses and bush - rats which swarmed up at the very front of [them]3462-them . And when those incredible mass of creatures had closed up on [a man]312-a man and embraced [him]312-a man biting [us]3452-our from [our]3452-our heads down to [our]3452-our feet and the shots of [our]3452-our guns had proven completely useless before [them]3462-them , [we]3452-our resolved that [we]3452-our simply had to resign [ourselves]3452-our to the very worst . grass - cutters simply leaped at [us]3452-our and were too numerous . It was exactly in this manner that [the Terrifying - babboon]4709-the terrifying - babboon appeared on this day in the company of spirits . After this , [I]0-i chose yet [another person from [our]3555-our side]3554-another person from our side and [his]3554-another person from our side own name was [[The Cat]230-the cat ’s Rear]3556-the cat ’s rear . What a pity that [I]0-i shall be forced to by - pass the detail of [his]3554-another person from our side own veritable exploit on this day because of the flight of [our]3555-our time . Also [I]0-i shall have to leave out most of the details of [my]0-i encounter with [the Terrifying - babboon]4709-the terrifying - babboon , in the stead of this , [I]0-i shall stick to the more memorable moments of the contest . But that which is important about the meeting and which [I]0-i want [you]3558-you to note is that [we]3555-our were the very last to lock hands . When [we]3555-our had sparred for a long moment of time , socked , turn - twisted and joined in the death grapple without [anyone]1570-anyone overthrowing the other , [Terrifying - babboon]224-terrifying - babboon waxed hot and started to change into various shapes , transforming [himself]224-terrifying - babboon . It was the elephant that [he]3554-another person from our side turned [himself]224-terrifying - babboon to lastly but [I]0-i was determined that [I]0-i would not transform to an elephant , rather [I]0-i preferred [egbe]231-egbe to place [me]0-i on [his]3554-another person from our side back so that [I]0-i began to ride [him]3554-another person from our side about like a horse . That concluded , [he]3554-another person from our side became a buffalo and resolved that [he]3554-another person from our side would gore [me]0-i to death with [his]3554-another person from our side antlers but [I]0-i hurried into a rock and when [he]3554-another person from our side hit this rock near did it remain for [him]3554-another person from our side to break [his]3554-another person from our side antlers . In the end , [he]3554-another person from our side retransformed to [a large river]3560-a large river and [I]0-i also transformed [myself]0-i into sunlight , [the hunters]2120-the hunters also turned to birds and flew to tree - tops . When [I]0-i began to shine from high up and [my]0-i haze heated down on the waters beneath , [the Terrifying - babboon]4709-the terrifying - babboon agreed , [he]4709-the terrifying - babboon doffed [his]4709-the terrifying - babboon hat and confessed that [I]0-i was superior . So did [we]3563-we come to the end of the fight but this did not imply that [we]3563-we had come any near the end of the war . [We]3563-we continued [our]3563-we contention with those animals for another full montli and in many diverse ways did [we]3563-we fight with [them]3564-them . There cams ; a time when [Ireke]141-ireke suggested that [we]3563-we permit [him]141-ireke to shov/ those creatures one or two feats from [his]141-ireke flute for a day and [we]3563-we consented , gave hint of this to [[our]3563-we opponents]3565-our opponents and askt d [them]3565-our opponents to prepare to meet with only [Ireke]141-ireke on the battleground on the day that came next . Truthfully when day - break arrived , [Ireke]141-ireke headed for the battle - front flute in hand and when [he]141-ireke began to apply [himself]141-ireke to revelling in [his]141-ireke craft , no animal was left in [that 171

forest]3566-that 171 forest who did not take part in dancing . The elephant grew so tipsy in [his]141-ireke dance that [he]141-ireke began to trample several of animals under [his]141-ireke feet , stampeding [them]3564-them to [their]3564-them deaths . [The monkey]3567-the monkey danced and leapt with joy , [man]3733-man and sprite raised limbs of dance and this became [our]3563-we sole preoccupation on this day till night - time when [we]3563-we retreated [home]387-home and retired . Therewith , [Kumodiran]123-kumodiran also desired to perform in the manner of [Ireke]141-ireke . [He]123-kumodiran made [us]3563-we broadcast to the animals that [they]3570-they should all surface with [their]3570-they cudgels and give [him]141-ireke a bit of an exercise throughout a day . And this was what the animals and ghommids did forthwith arriving with sticks and batons but [Inherited Clubs]124-clubs obviously had overdone [his]141-ireke bit , for even while it was a truth that [his]141-ireke nature conformed so well with the strokes of clubs , to the extent that if [he]141-ireke had not yet received [his]141-ireke complete dosage of them for one day [he]141-ireke was not active , notwithstanding , [no man]3770-no man ever smacked [him]141-ireke more than forty times in one go all of [his]141-ireke life . And on this day of which [we]3563-we speak , the number of sticks which landed on [his]141-ireke body surpassed six hundred ; even so did [we]3563-we lose [the man]318-the man . [Ibembe Olokunrun]118-ibembe - olokunrun healed from [his]118-ibembe - olokunrun infirmities . [He]118-ibembe - olokunrun [himself]118-ibembe - olokunrun had repented of [his]118-ibembe - olokunrun old ways , mainly because [he]118-ibembe - olokunrun had been keeping the company of [well - meaning people]3573-well - meaning people . [We]3563-we came to a point where [we]3563-we slaughtered several animals at a time and [the man]318-the man ate until [he]318-the man came to satisfaction for the very first time . [His]118-ibembe - olokunrun protuberating stomach also diminished to the extent that [he]118-ibembe - olokunrun now began to eat the same measure as appropriate to [normal human beings]3575-normal human beings . [We]3563-we continued for another month after this combatting the animals of [the forest]456-the forest without victor nor vanquished ; actually the matter was getting to become a shame for [us]3563-we now . One day , acting on an inspiration , [I]0-i went in private and knelt before [[my]0-i God]978-my god . [I]0-i begged and entreated [Him]978-my god to intervene , to rescue [us]3563-we from imminent shame ; [my]0-i face turned upwards [I]0-i bellowed piteously even to an extent that before the time when [I]0-i rose tears had welled up in [my]0-i eyes . And so , one night [I]0-i saw [[my]0-i 172

mother]3578-my 172 mother come up from the dome of death to visit [me]0-i . [She]3578-my 172 mother woke [me]0-i from sleep and greeted [me]0-i ; [she]3578-my 172 mother encouraged [me]0-i by saying [I]0-i should not lose heart , that 1 must surely emerge victorious over the animals . [She]3578-my 172 mother disclosed how before [she]3578-my 172 mother resolved to rise to [my]0-i aid , [she]3578-my 172 mother had asked and got the divine sanctions of [God]227-god for [my]0-i cause . Whereupon [she]3578-my 172 mother brought out kola - nuts , certain seeds^ of fruit - trees and grains of corn and handed them to [me]0-i saying those were kolas of pride , corns of pride and seeds of pride . Thus did [she]3578-my 172 mother direct [me]0-i that , the moment [I]0-i rose in the morning , [I]0-i should serve the kolanuts of pride to [the ghommids]1132-the ghommids , the corns of pride to birds and the fruit - seeds of pride to the animals to eat assuring [me]0-i that once [I]0-i carried this out , [our]3580-we triumph upon [them]1132-the ghommids was well nigh . Those said , [she]3578-my 172 mother entered back mto the ground the way [she]3578-my 172 mother had come . At day - break [I]0-i applied these items as [[my]0-i mother]3767-my mother schooled [me]0-i , gave [all the diverse creatures]3582-all the diverse creatures the things to eat and instant was their effects on [them]3582-all the diverse creatures . [One leader of the ghommid]3583-one leader of the ghommid stopped to hearken to the words of ten ; [a sprite which lacked legs to walk with]3584-a sprite which lacked legs to walk with began to insist upon being the chairperson of sprites , [duikers]3585-duikers began to disregard the persons of the lions , cats boasted to being the stronger of tigers , even birds began to pay [us]3580-we discreet visits proclaiming [their]3586-their supports for [us]3580-we ; the palm - bird asked [us]3580-we to promise that once [we]3580-we won the battle [we]3580-we shall place [him]3587-him above the kite . The night owl brought bribes to [us]3580-we enjoining [us]3580-we to bar the bats once [we]3580-we overcame from accompanying [him]3587-him out in [their]3587-him nightly walks ; [cattle e^ets]3588-cattle e^ets desired to score higher in beauty than peacocks , [they]3588-cattle e^ets opined that [they]3588-cattle e^ets were afterall immaculate white in regalia so what was stopping [us]3580-we from making [them]3588-cattle e^ets [the king of home birds]3589-the king of home birds ? Even so was dissension sown into [their]3588-cattle e^ets company and [we]3580-we gained in [our]3580-we chances upon [them]3588-cattle e^ets . In the battle that followed after this , the birds and the animals refused to receive [their]3588-cattle e^ets orders from [the Terrifying - babboon]224-terrifying - babboon so that instant was [our]3580-we victory over [them]3588-cattle e^ets . Even as [we]3580-we dispensed with this war . [we]3580-we faced up straight for [our]3580-we destination on [the Mount of Thought]240-the mount of thought . But as [we]3580-we found out , it was one thing even to arrii ’ e in [the place]435-the place and yet completely 173[3588-cattle e^ets]

another to reach close to the tree where [we]3580-we would pluck the fruits of Thought . The tree was located in [some sacred forest]3591-some sacred forest right on top of [a cragged hill called [Triumph]55-triumph]3592-a cragged hill called triumph . So perilous was the appearance of [this place]2438-this place that [I]0-i offered to go up [it]2438-this place alone ; [I]0-i suffered one thing or two before [I]0-i could finally surmount it to the very top . And even after [I]0-i had managed to penetrate [the forbidden forest]3594-the forbidden forest and [I]0-i threw one solitary glance ahead of [me]0-i , [I]0-i found again to [my]0-i surprise that much visitations still lay in the front waiting for [me]0-i — for it seemed that the floor of that entire surrounding was spread with snakes and no single species of them was left in the yorld which had not made [the vicinity a place of habitation]3595-the vicinity a place of habitation ; viperss king cobras with tapering tails abounding [there all about]3596-there all about . [The tree of [Ironu]117-ironu]3597-the tree of ironu was itself submerged by thorns with choking tips and these were keener than the top of needles , they covered the tree from the leaf down to the root . Those tribulations which [I]0-i underwent in [that place]720-that place , when [I]0-i begin to think of them can not , very unluckily , be rehved with mere words of mouth . In the end [I]0-i reached close to this tree , strained forward and embraced one fruit which was easiest within arm ’s length and it was made of silver , turning from hence to flee because the neck of that same tree was having an angry rush of soldier ants , those persisting in [their]3599-their bites , stuck close onto and pierced ferociously through [a man]312-a man ’s bottoms choosing [their]3599-their sports wherever [they]3599-their thought best . [I]0-i turned from hither to face [town]573-town after [I]0-i had bagged this affair , to the place where [I]0-i left [[my]0-i fellows]2606-my fellows . But even as [I]0-i began to disengage [myself]0-i from the straps and creepers of [the forest]456-the forest [I]0-i was met by [a man in spotless white garb]3604-a man in spotless white garb . [He]3604-a man in spotless white garb it was who stopped [me]0-i and pointed out that [my]0-i task was not over just yet , that as it was the fruit which [I]0-i held was having little substance without another tree ’s fruit called [Reliance - on - God]3605-reliance - on - god . [The man]318-the man gave [me]0-i directions hence , to where [I]0-i would find this tree [he]318-the man spoke about and [I]0-i abandoned [my]0-i course and began to seek the tree , which finally turned out to be in the same neighbourhood as Thought which [I]0-i had just 174

left . Flushing the trunk of [this tree of [Keliance - on - God]56-keliance - on - god]3607-this tree of keliance - on - god were slimes which rendered every effort [I]0-i made to climb it a frustration . Seven whole times did [I]0-i entwine [myself]0-i to the tree and [I]0-i fell on [my]0-i buttocks on all seven times . In the end , [I]0-i had an idea , [I]0-i rubbed [my]0-i stomach with sand and therewith rose with all [my]0-i strength to the boulders where [I]0-i found a fruit that was of pure gold , red bright and shining . Even as [I]0-i packed [my]0-i fruits , turned and began [my]0-i journey back again [I]0-i was awaited by yet [another person]3608-another person - this a ghommid , a seven - eyed , with [his]3608-another person eyes placed round about [his]3608-another person head . [He]3608-another person handed [me]0-i a letter and when [I]0-i glanced at it [I]0-i found that it came from [[my]0-i wife]4246-my wife . There [she]4246-my wife recounts how [she]4246-my wife has followed [me]0-i with [her]4246-my wife eyes throughout all [my]0-i ordeals , praising [my]0-i forbearances and endurance , even declaring that [she]4246-my wife would no longer bear to live apart from [me]0-i , that [she]4246-my wife has forgiven all [my]0-i misconducts and that now [I]0-i should be sure to stop to see [her]4246-my wife on [our]3610-our way back . There is no allowance today for sharing with [you]3611-you the tale of [our]3610-our return journey [home]387-home beginning from the time when [I]0-i re - joined [[my]0-i compatriots]3613-my compatriots at [the crest of [the hill]1180-the hill]3614-the crest of the hill down to the time when [we]3610-our arrived back in [[our]3610-our native land]3616-our native land . But this [I]0-i think [you]3611-you ought to make a note of , that [I]0-i stopped briefly in [[[my]0-i wife]4246-my wife ’s house]3618-my wife ’s house at [the River of [Remembrance]57-remembrance]3619-the river of remembrance where [she]4246-my wife welcomed [us]3610-our and took [me]0-i to see the elegant splendours and delights of [the place]435-the place , including [her]4246-my wife own personal riches . Thereupon [she]4246-my wife made a suggestion that [I]0-i return to meet [her]4246-my wife at [the River of Remembrance]3619-the river of remembrance soon as [we]3610-our got back [home]387-home and gave [our]3610-our gifts to [[our]3610-our king]729-our king , to the end that [we]3610-our may thus be rejoined together and start off a new existence of plenitude and resplendence . And precisely this was what [I]0-i did ; when [the few remaining hunters]3624-the few remaining hunters and [I]0-i returned to [[our]3610-our town]628-our town , [[our]3610-our king who by this time had advanced in years]3626-our king who by this time had advanced in years was greatly joyed , [he]3626-our king who by this time had advanced in years made presents of various valuable things to [us]3610-our and [we]3610-our also handed [him]3626-our king who by this time had advanced in years the fruits which [we]3610-our brought with [us]3610-our - the fruit of Thought and the fruit of [Reliance - on - God]58-reliance - on - god . These concluded , [I]0-i headed off to be with [[my]0-i wife]4246-my wife .

[My]0-i coming here at this time to tell this tale to [[my]0-i friend]333-my friend here was [our]3610-our joint ideas , this beside the fact that [[my]0-i father]3742-my father before [his]3742-my father death also left instruction for [me]0-i in this respect . Now [friends]3903-friends , [I]0-i give salutation to [everyone of [you]3903-friends]4301-everyone of you , to even [the last man among [you]3903-friends]3632-the last man among you . Herein comes the moment when [the owner of [the house]319-the house]3633-the owner of the house goes back [home]387-home . So did [the man]318-the man speak , and when [he]318-the man had paused thus , [we]3610-our saw [him]318-the man no more . But one wise head among [the people who assembled in [[my]0-i house]645-my house to hear [him]318-the man]3637-the people who assembled in my house to hear him said that [his]318-the man vanis^ng gives [him]318-the man no surprise whatsoever , for [the man]318-the man and [Akara - Ogun]109-akara - ogun were closely alike , that [he]318-the man and [the one who fathers Born - Losers]3640-the one who fathers born - losers were of like make . The words therefore are these , [[you]3903-friends children of [the world]293-the world]3641-you children of the world , in particular [you]3903-friends who are [students in places of learning]3643-students in places of learning , and [you]3903-friends who are [[their]3643-students in places of learning teachers]3644-their teachers also . [I]0-i render all of these things to [your]3903-friends contemplations , and leave all the rest with [God]227-god [[our]3645-our king]729-our king and [Creator]187-the creator . Even as [you]3903-friends continue with [your]3903-friends day - to - day perambulations in [your]3903-friends hves , [I]0-i exhort [you]3903-friends to make a close investigation of all things , that [you]3903-friends take special notice of those things that made those of by - gone times to stumble , that [you]3903-friends keep also in mind the part which forbearance plays in the lives of [men]297-men , so that in so doing [you]3903-friends also may come to be able to overcome [your]3903-friends own difficulties . [I]0-i will bring this book to a close right now , and may [[our]3645-our God]931-our god preserve the lives of [everyone of [you]3903-friends]4301-everyone of you , [I]0-i know that [we]3645-our shall have cause in days to come to hear news of [one another]1108-one another . [[Your]3903-friends home]4574-your home , s thereon will prosper , [[your]3903-friends roads]3652-your roads will yield goodness , [you]3903-friends will all hence make forward leaps and not lag behind , [your]3903-friends possessions will not know ruin , and for ever and ever shall [you]3903-friends behold the good tidings of life . 176

GLOSSARY OF YORUBA WORDS Ayedetu - eda — Prominent character , name suggestive of dubiousness . [Ajayi agbada]99-sesan ajayi _ common Yoruba name . — loose Yoruba leisure dress . [Akara - Ogun]109-akara - ogun — same of [first saga ’s hero]3653-first saga ’s hero ; morsel spells amala — edible paste from yam flour . Ajedubule — [[hero]3654-hero ’s ( [Irinkerindo]73-elegbeje]3655-hero ’s ( irinkerindo ) [father in - law aluko — bird aran — tough velvet material Afeaye — name hinting at vanity and profligate pleasures of life]3656-father in - law aluko — bird aran — tough velvet material afeaye — name hinting at vanity and profligate pleasures of life . [Baba - onirun^bon - yeuke]145-baba onirungbon - yeuke — [old man with sweeping beard]3657-old man with sweeping beard . bata — a set of traditional drums comprising of [a leader set with smattering sound and a base . It ’s dance , very strenous , invol­ ves the simultaneous manipula­ a tion of two shoulders , and legs . in symmetrical and assymmetri- cal directions]3658-a leader set with smattering sound and a base . it ’s dance , very strenous , invol­ ves the simultaneous manipula­ a tion of two shoulders , and legs . in symmetrical and assymmetri- cal directions . [Danasungbo]177-danasungbo ‘ — [man habitually setting bushes]4745-man habitually setting bushes ; 53.4 . on fire . [dandogo]232-dandogo lu — formal Yoruba wear . dansiki — [male top wear egbe]4746-male top wear egbe — a spell that is believed to give [its user]4747-its user the abifity to travel in the air invisibly . [Esu]132-esu — in [Fagunwa]82-fagunwa ’s ‘[177-danasungbo] reworking of Christo - Yoruba cosmogonic myths , [Esu]132-esu is synonymous with [Satan]138-satan but remains as in the ac­ tual mythic structure — [the god of the cross - roads]3659-the god of the cross - roads . 177

Elegbeje — [Forest of a Thousand]286-forest of a thousand and Four Hundred Deities . eko — corn mealie ewedu — vegetable Edidare — [a dunce town]3661-a dunce town . Ewe - eye — suggests [bearer]3662-bearer to be [a herbalist who brings much means to [his]3662-bearer profession]3663-a herbalist who brings much means to his profession . etu — a handwoven smock , very formal Eni - aye — One of [the World]24-the world , [[hero]3654-hero ’s mother]3665-hero ’s mother . [Ewadapo]215-ewadapo — literally repository of beautiful attributes . [Elegbara]155-elegbara — [sub - human semi - god who wanders and inhabits [the forests]1152-the forests]3666-sub - human semi - god who wanders and inhabits the forests . tira charmed poiion usually encased in miniature leatherwork . togo yeri 180

Dapo Adeniyi was born in November 1963 . [He]3690-he attended [[Ijebu]61-ijebu - Jesa Grammar School]62-ijebu - jesa grammar school , now in [Osun State]63-osun state , [Nigeria]2-nigeria and [the University of [Ibadan]4-ibadan]64-the university of ibadan where [he]3690-he read Theatre Arts and founded a literary magazine . [The River Prawn]65-the river prawn . [His]3690-he radio play , , Helot was broadcast by BBC African Service in 1986 . [He]3690-he wrote J the screen adaptation for [Soyinka]74-soyinka ’s autobiographical novel,^ Ake : The Years of Childhood and recently completed a fulk length play , TIte Return of [Habibu Timbuktu]235-habibu timbuktu . [He]3690-he . is currently [Reviews Editor of the Daily Times of [Nigeria]2-nigeria]3691-reviews editor of the daily times of nigeria , [Lagos]22-lagos . The third in the series of [the late Chief D. O. Fagunwa]236-the late chief d. o. fagunwa ’s classical novels [IRINKERINDO NINU IGBO ELEGBEJE]73-elegbeje now translated into the English language maintains the former theme of Quest and pattern of narration already established in [his]3690-he earlier novels , OGBOJU ODE NINU IGBO 1 [RUNMALE]66-runmale and [IGBO OLODUMARE]67-igbo olodumare . The quest for meaning and self - apprehension drives [human heroes]3692-human heroes , [Yoruba hunters]3693-yoruba hunters , to pay the price for communal improve ­ ment [i]0-i , nd for the attainment of the ultimate ‘ thought ’[0-i] that is so necessary for social advancement . The obstacles remain the same : much hardship and a iong distance travel across [[Fagunwa]82-fagunwa ’s lofty but [now familiar fantastv • forests]3695-now familiar fantastv • forests]3694-fagunwa ’s lofty but now familiar fantastv • forests . [[Their]3692-human heroes opponents]3696-their opponents are [those same ghommids , spirits and [elves]3698-elves : non - human yet nearly human personae who inhabit [D. O. [The human char­ acters]3699-the human char­ acters are above all mostly related to [former heroes]3700-former heroes : [Akara- Oogun]237-akara- oogun , [Kako Oni - kumo - ekun]238-kako oni - kumo - ekun , [Olohun - iyo]142-olohun - iyo and even , [Agbako]149-agbako .
